highlights.highlight:
Toss: Kings XI Punjab won the toss and have opted to bowl.

The IPL is back at the Eden Gardens with home team KKR hosting KXIP.

Both teams are coming off wins in their last matches.

Kings XI Punjab are presently languishing at the bottom of the points table.

Kings XI Punjab have relieved David Miller from captaincy duties and been replaced by India Test opener Murali Vijay.

Shaun Marsh has been ruled out due to a back injury and KXIP have replaced roped in Hashim Amla as his replacement.

cricket_live_blog.display_title_landing_page: 11 on 11: India defeat Pakistan at Eden, 11 WC matches, 11 wins)
cricket_live_blog.title: 11 on 11: India defeat Pakistan at Eden, 11 WC matches, 11 wins

details.content_title: Virat Kohli once again proved he was the most valuable player for the team. India battled against immense pressure to win against Pakistan today. Expect some fireworks from this Indian team from now. That's all we have for you tonight. Good night folks.
In this format every team is a good team. We want to compete. We want to be here for the final, but as of now we want to take one game at a time: Dhoni
I didn't expect it to spin so much. The spinners got plenty of help out there. It got slightly better in the second half and they had only one spinner. I think we can still do better: MS Dhoni
Pakistan should learn to handle pressure from India: Afridi

First of all, I want to congratulate Dhoni and his team for playing well. I did not expect the pitch to spin so much, but no excuse. I think we didn't score enough runs. We were short by 30-35 runs. Their spinners bowled well. I think we didn't bowl in the right areas and I didn't bowl well. Virat Kohli played an awesome innings: Afridi

Yuvraj came out, weathered the storm and smacked a few. It's great for him that he came out in a pressure situation. He's feeling confident. I think a score on the board always helps me calculate better: Kohli

It was a challenging wicket out there. You need new challenges every innings that you play. I was disappointed that I got out for about 25 in the last game. I knew if I had scored 40-45 we could have won. That really hurt because we don't bat like that at home. Today it was all about keeping calm and luckily I got a great partnership with Yuvraj: Kohli

Well played India. Class run chase in tough conditions. Something for the rest of the competition to learn from! Good night all!

— Glenn Maxwell (@Gmaxi_32) March 19, 2016

It's a delighted @imVkohli who gets the Player of the Match and shares the #TwitterMirror with the #IND fans! #WT20 pic.twitter.com/Xj7HpYPG0A

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
Virat Kohli is the Man of the Match
15.5 overs: INDIA WIN BY SIX WICKETs as Dhoni completes an easy single. India have now won all their five World T20 matches vs Pakistan.
15.4 overs: SIX! Dhoni smashes Irfan in the stands. India have drawn level. India are almost there. This is sensational stuff.
15.2 overs: FOUR! Kohli smashes a poor delivery from Irfan- short and it was duly punished by Kohli. India are on the verge of a big win
14.3 overs: Kohli brings up his 14th fifty off 34 balls. What a knock this has been by the Indian star. Akram heaps praise on the Indian run-machine
14.2 overs: FOUR! Kohli executes another cover drive . India are racing towards a win
14 overs: Top, top shot by Kohli off Amir, as India reach 99/4, chasing 119
13.1 overs: Amir back in the attack. He will have to make the difference here.
12.1 overs: Afridi back in the attack and FOUR! Cracking cover drive from Kohli, That was right in the slot to be hit.
12 overs: WICKET! Yuvraj falls to Wahab for 24 as India reach 84/4, chasing 119. But Kohli is looking great in the middle and India are still in with a great chance
11.2 overs: Risky shot from Yuvraj but it results in a single and brings Kohli back on strike
11.1 overs: SIX! Yuvraj has joined the party, he sends Wahab crashing into the stands. The Eden has erupted. India are eyeing an easy win here
10.5 overs: FOUR! Kohli is turning this game around for India; he has brought up his 50-run partnership with Yuvraj Singh.
10.2 overs: SIX! Kohli blasts Malik into the stands. India now need less than 50 to win this one. What a moment it would be at the Eden Gardens
9.2 overs: Sensible batting by Kohli. All Yuvraj needs to do is stay on at the other end. There's still plenty of batting to come for India. They should be able to win it from here
9.1 overs: FOUR! Kohli greets Riaz into the attack with a good-looking shot and the Eden erupts.
9.1 overs: Wahab Riaz in the attack for Pakistan with India 54/3, half-way into the innings
8.3 overs: Kohli plays Malik away for a single as India bring up their 50 in the ninth over
8.1 overs: Malik in the attack. Spin will be key for Pakistan here
8 overs: Sensible from Yuvraj and Kohli. They are not taking risks now and are managing to get 4-5 runs an over. IND 46/3
7.3 overs: Afridi puts a slip for Kohli. The Indian batsmen nudges this one in the gap and gets a single.
7.1 overs: Yuvraj gets a single off Afridi's first ball. Kohli is the key man for India. He is a busy player who can keep the required run-rate at check

Whosoever said the Nagpur pitch 'misbehaved' has to be at the Eden Gardens tonight #IndvsPak #WT20 #superhitmuqabala

— Vikrant Gupta (@vikrantgupta73) March 19, 2016
6.4 overs: 10 runs off this over so far. This over has been productive for India. These two shouldn't do anything rash here.
6.3 overs: Four! This time it's Yuvraj. A good cover-drive. Mohammad Amir tries his best but couldn't stop the ball from reaching the fence. Pressure on Sami here. IND 37/3
6.1 overs: Four! Cracking shot! Virat stays on the back-foot and eases the ball past the point fielder. IND 32/3
The required run-rate is 7.58 now. India need a solid stand here. They have men who can finish the game, But the middle order should stand up. They need 91 from 72
6 overs: Five runs from Afridi's first over. IND 28/3
5.5 overs: A couple of wides from Afridi. The ball is spinning a lot.
5.1 overs: Shahid Afridi into the attack. He should be effective on this track. Ind 25/3
India have been reduced to 23/3 in 4.5 overs. Sami was struggling to get the ball right in the first two balls and now he has taken two in two.
4.4 overs: WICKET! Two in two for Sami. Suresh Raina loses his leg-stump. Sami on-a-hat-trick
4.3 overs: WICKET! Sami has beaten Dhawan with pace here. Bog blow for India. India 23/2, chasing 119
4.1 overs: FOUR! Sami in the attack and gives some room outside the off-stump and Dhawan punishes that.
3 overs: End of a brilliant over from Mohammad Amir. Two runs and a wicket from his over. IND 16/1
Rohit Sharma was looking to go over the in-field. He was trying to take the game away from Pakistan early on.
2.1 overs: WICKET! Rohit Sharma departs for 10. This is a massive blow for India at the top. The ball went high in the air and Shoib Malik did well there to hold on to it. IND 14/1
1.5 overs: Four! Rohit pulls 0ne to the boundary. This is a good start for Team India. IND 13/1
1.1 overs: Four! Wide and short from Mohammad Ifran and Rohit is too good for these, smashes to the point boundary. IND 8/0
1 overs: Mohammad Amir bowls a tidy over to start the proceedings for Pakistan. IND 4/0
0.3 overs: Amir has already beaten Rohit once. Indian batsmen have to apply themselves on this wicket
0.1 overs: The Indian innings is underway. Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan are out in the middle. Mohammad Amir has the new ball in his hands

Ashwin and Nehra were brilliant for India with the ball today. The fielding was also good. It's very important to cut down on extra runs on these tracks. Pakistan batsmen batted with sense today. Malik provided the necessary push for the team. It will be an interesting chase here at the Eden Gardens. Join us in a short while..
Maxwell is impressed by Jadeja's work on the field

On a side note, gotta admit I love watching Jadeja field when im not playing against him! Moves fast across the ground and has an #armcannon

— Glenn Maxwell (@Gmaxi_32) March 19, 2016

Both the teams seem to have misread the pitch. Pakistan are playing four seamers on this track. Will it help them? We saw India missing an extra spinner there. Strange Dhoni didn't give Ashwin an extra over, neither did he use Yuvraj Singh there. It's going to be tough for India.

India need 119 to register their first win at this year's ICC World Twenty20 at home. Looking at how the track behaved, the Indian batsmen have be on top of their game to gun down this total. They need to score at 6.56 runs an over on this track
18 overs: Bumrah finishes off with a good over conceding only seven runs off it. Pakistan finish with 118/5 on the board. The Indian batsmen have their task cut out on this pitch
17.4 overs: Bumrah has been brilliant so far with his slower balls. Five runs so far. PAK 116/5
16.2 overs: WICKET! The danger man Shoaib Malik departs. Nehra removes Malik with a slower ball.
16 overs: End of a successful over for India. PAK 103/4 with two more overs to go
15.5 overs: Wicket! Jadeja removes Akmal for 21 (16). Akmal tried to cut the ball one to see the ball going to Dhoni's gloves. PAK 101/4
15.3 overs: Four! Malik at it again. He sweeps one to the mid-wicket boundary to bring up Pakistan's  hundred PAK 101/3
The last two overs have been very good for Pakistan. Their run-rate now is 6.26 and on this pitch anything over six would be a nightmare for the chasing team
15 overs: Dot ball to finish another expensive over. 13 runs off it. Pak 95/3
14.5 overs: Four! One more from Malik. Poor bowling from Bumrah, he has not been able to get the yorker right.
14.4 overs: Four! Malik is on fire. Slashes Bumrah to the cover boundary. The ball raised to the boundary ropes. Pak 91/3
14.2 overs: Well bowled by Bumrah. He fired it wide and Malik could afford only a single
14.1 overs: No ball! Bumrah had overstepped. This is a free-hit. Good opportunity for Malik to make things worse

13.6 overs: SIX! This time, it's Umar Akmal. Not-so-clever bowling from Pandya. This one was a pitched short and Akmal just had to slash his bat across the line. 15 runs off this over. Might prove to be costly in the end. PAK 82/3
13.4 overs: SIX! Shoib Malik hits the first six of the Pakistan's innings. He deposits one into the stands. PAK 75/3
13 overs: Tidy over Nehra, two runs off it. Pakistan are 67/3. How much would India want to chase on this track? Remember Pakistan have a wrist-spinner in Afridi
It was Amithab Bachchan who sang the national anthem today

The #IND National Anthem sung by @SrBachchan ahead of #INDvPAK #WT20https://t.co/NdXaA7665y

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
12 overs: It was turning out to be a good over for India but Jadeja's throw cost India five extra runs. Pakistan 65/3
11.5 overs: WICKET! Pandya removes Afridi for 8 and Pakistan are 60/3. Do they have a target in mind for India? The pitch, we repeat, is turning square.
11.2 overs: Pandya in the attack and FOUR! Umar Aknal punishes a rank poor delivery. As it should have been
10.2 overs: It's turning more at the Eden than it did at Jamtha, feels Wasim Akram.
10 overs: Pakistan 51/2, with 8 overs to go.
9.3 overs: FOUR! Boom, boom Afridi goes after Bumrah and he sends that to the fence. The Eden is stunned into silence again. Emotions swinging like a pendulum here tonight
9.2 overs: WICKET! Bumrah has removed Shehzad for 25. This was an important strike for India. Pakistan 42/2
9.1 overs: FOUR! Shehzad works on the pace and places that one from Bumrah nicely. Easy pickings for Pakistan
9 overs: Good over from Jadeja as Pakistan reach 42/1. But like Wasim Akram said, it's an almost unplayable pitch,
8 overs: Pakistan 39/1 - the big news is that Shahid Afridi has come out to bat at N0.3
7.4 overs: WICKET! Sharjeel falls to Raina, thanks to a stunning catch by Pandya. Pakistan 38/1
7.1 overs: No surprises here. Raina in the attack. India have no extra spinner. Wonder why Harbhajan Singh is not playing in place of Hardik Pandya
7 overs: Jadeja troubled Shehzad with his turn and bounce but Pakistan are 34/0 on a rank turner. How much would India like to chase here?
6.4 overs: FOUR! Lucky runs for Shehzad and Pakistan would be happy to take that.
6.1 overs: Ravindra Jadeja in the attack early
6 overs: Four runs off the over. Pakistan 28/0 after the powerplay. This pitch is turning square
5.1 overs: Ashwin to bowl his third one here. This looks like another rank-turner
5 overs: FOUR! After struggling to put bat to ball for three balls, Sharjeel hammers it to the fence. Cracking shot. Pakistan 24/0
4.2 overs: Sharjeel struggling with his timing. He is looking uncomfortable.
4.1 overs: Bowling change. Bumrah replaces Nehra in the attack.
4 overs: Big turn and bounce from Ashwin. Pakistan 19/0
Ahmed Shehzad brings up 1000 runs in T20 Internationals
3.3 overs: FOUR! Shehzad steps down the track to kill the spin and the ball races away to the fence. The Eden is silent
3.1 overs: Ashwin to continue and Shehzad picks a quick single
3 overs: First boundary of the innings. Sharjeel picks up the first poor delivery from Nehra and the ball reaches the ropes. Pakistan 12/0
2.5 overs: Good fielding by Raina and there's a cheer, a loud cheer.
2 overs: Excellent over from Ashwin. Turn and bounce already. Just two off the over.
1.4 overs: Just the single from Ashwin so far. India are looking sharp tonight
1.2 overs: Ashwin in the attack and he gets immediate turn. Go India!
1 overs: Good start from Nehra! He almost got a wicket there with a slower ball. Shehzad was bamboozled. PAK 3/0
0.3 overs: Sharjeel hits one straight to the point fielder. PAK 2/0
Ashish Nehra has the new ball. He is looking all set. Sharjeel Khan and Ahmed Shehzad are at the crease for Pakistan
The feel is electric at the Eden Gardens. Amithab Bachchan rendered the Indian national anthem
The two teams are walking out for the national anthems. Sourav Ganguly led the way with the World T20 trophy in his hand. Mamata Banerjee is also there
Brian Lara says the par score here is 170. 18 overs, 170, What do you people think?

170runs https://t.co/YJ3oVcFrrS

— Brian Lara (@BrianLara) March 19, 2016
Here's a look at the playing XIs
India: Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, Yuvraj Singh, MS Dhoni(w/c), Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Ashish Nehra, Jasprit Bumrah
Pakistan: Sharjeel Khan, Ahmed Shehzad, Mohammad Hafeez, Umar Akmal, Shoaib Malik, Sarfraz Ahmed(w), Shahid Afridi(c), Wahab Riaz, Mohammad Sami, Mohammad Amir, Mohammad Irfan
It's a good call to bowl first, because the pitch was covered, but now we have to put a decent total on the board: Shahid Afridi
Past doesn't really matter, but as far as cricket is concerned, you have to be at your best on that particular day, adds Dhoni
The wicket has been under the covers for quite some time, so it might be a bit sticky: Dhoni at the toss
"Pakistan's strength is fast bowling," says Dhoni.
TOSS: India have won the toss and have opted to bowl first against Pakistan. Team unchanged
Team huddle ahead of the toss

Team #IND huddle - atmosphere building up like crazy! #INDvPAK #WT20 https://t.co/wvuFOrWGSM

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
The two captain Shahid Afridi and MS Dhoni are walking out for the toss..
It's now confirmed! Toss in five-minutes time. The players are warming up at the Edens
The match will start at 20.30 IST: Reports
Toss will happen at 20.10 IST, it will be 18 overs per-side, according to reports
Thank you for the reception. Hope it's a great game today, Imran Khan said at Eden Gardens
No news on the toss yet, no official update
Now the players are out on the field practising

The run machine is gearing up at Eden Gardens for #Ind v #Pak - @imVkohli #WT20 pic.twitter.com/5vArZ3AgJG

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 19, 2016

Former Pakistan Captains - @ImranKhanPTI and @wasimakramlive felicitated at Eden Gardens by West Bengal CM pic.twitter.com/50KsuCKOij

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 19, 2016
I want to thank Sourav Ganguly and the Cricket Association of Bengal for inviting me here. May the better team win. May the peace prevail between Pakistan and India: Amithab Bachchan
Thank you so much for organising the big event in Kolkata. We'll give the necessary security for the matches in Kolkata: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee
No updates on the toss yet.  As we said earlier we'll lose overs from 20.15 IST

The scene right now in Eden Gardens, toss is delayed with no news regarding inspection yet #INDvPAK #WT20 https://t.co/Txg3uGYyFa

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
That's a good sight!

The very latest scene at Eden Gardens with good progress #INDvPAK #WT20 pic.twitter.com/CupH8sG81m

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
Wasim Akram and Sunil Gavaskar having a chat near the boundary ropes.

The Sultan of Swing - @wasimakramlive greets the Little Master -Sunil Gavaskar ahead of #Ind v #Pak at Eden Gardens pic.twitter.com/yROAe4NMoc

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 19, 2016
The covers have been removed from the ground. The umpires are out on the field
Meanwhile, we will start losing overs in the men's game if the match doesn't start by 20.15 IST. The cut-off time for a 5-over shootout is 22.20 IST.
Pakistan women have won the game by two runs (D/L)
It's all over at Kotla. The game between Pakistan women and India has been called off. Pakistan women were 77/6 chasing 97 against India women after rain interrupted play.
Good news! The covers are being removed from the ground. Sourav Ganguly is out on the field and having a chat with one of the groundsmen.

Cut-off time here in Delhi is 6.50pm. If there's no more cricket, then Pakistan win the match on the DLS by being 2 runs ahead. #WT20

— Alan Wilkins (@alanwilkins22) March 19, 2016
The crowd is making noise as the central covers are being removed again. There's no update on the toss yet
I have to lead the attack. I do well in big games, says Pakistan pacer Wahab Riaz at Eden Gardens
While we bring you updates on rain at Eden and Kotla, have a look at the teams' dressing rooms.

An exclusive look at the #IND and #PAK dressing rooms before the game here at Eden Gardens#INDvPAK #WT20https://t.co/ZOprte9zQ9

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016

It is pouring down here at Kotla. #Pak Women are 2 runs ahead on D/L #WT20 pic.twitter.com/9ItdYuofpJ

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 19, 2016

So, we hear it's sunny in Dharamsala and raining in Kolkata (and Delhi). #justsaying

— Alan Wilkins (@alanwilkins22) March 19, 2016

Rain has stopped the play between India women and Pakistan in Delhi. Pakistan women are two runs ahead according to D/L. Pak Wn 77/6 in 16 overs chasing 97 at the Kotla. Seems more covers are being brought in
Amithab Bachchan is at the Eden Gardens for singing India's national anthem..

Brilliant to have @SrBachchan & @ShafqatAmanatA alongside @SGanguly99 here at Eden Gardens #INDvPAK #WT20 pic.twitter.com/MfcxYMim5m

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
Suresh Raina and Ravindra Jadeja are watching the ground staff at action. They are removing the water off the covers and yeah the covers are still on
Light drizzle at Eden. It has nearly stopped. The Super Soppers are at work.
Latest images coming from Eden Gardens show light drizzle on and the entire ground under covers.
It has gone dark again at the Eden, says Shivani Gupta from Kolkata
No! The rain gods aren't showing mercy here. After things were improving, it has again started raining at the Eden Gardens.

HUGE forks of lightning and claps of thunder around the ground here in Kolkata #INDvPAK #WT20 https://t.co/kXftEPXUYD

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
Both teams have some records to maintain today. Pakistan have never lost at Eden Gardens and India have never lost against their arch rivals in a World T20 game
The central covers are being removed from the ground. Fingers crossed!

Meanwhile, the intensity of the rain has started to reduce at the Eden Gardens. The ground staff are clearing the water off the central covers. Good news is that the sky is clearing. We're 75 minutes away from the toss and Eden's new drainage system should do the job if there is no more rain
Pakistan legend Wasim Akram wants Afridi to be calm at the Eden Gardens. "If Afridi is calm, the entire team is calm," he says.
Pakistan are looking good having beaten Bangladesh by a big margin in their opening clash. Their skipper Shahid Afridi's boom-boom knock should have given a lot of encouragement for the team.
Thoughts on a rail-curtailed game? Advantage Pakistan?
Big news coming in. Bangladesh's Tasking Ahmed and Arafat Sunny suspended from bowling in international cricket due to illegal action
World Cup-winning skipper Imran Khan has landed in Kolkata. He has met the Pakistan team. A couple of words from the legend should help the in-form Pakistan team
It isn't looking good at Eden.. Check out these photos

The scene at Eden Gardens currently as the clouds overhead threaten rain ? Hopefully clearing up soon #INDvPAK #WT20 pic.twitter.com/GFlidmOXro

— ICC (@ICC) March 19, 2016
Not good news coming from the Eden Gardens. It' has been  since the morning and the rain got a bit heavier now. Not just the pitch, but the entire ground has been covered

India need to win today to stay alive in the tournament after their shock defeat against New Zealand. India also have the burden of records and history to look after - they have never lost to Pakistan in World Cups and World T20s.
Hello and Welcome to the Live Coverage of the big-ticket clash at the Eden Gardens

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: Pakistan batted calmly on a tricky wicket to post 118/5 in 18 overs against India at the Eden Gardens  (Live Scorecard)

metatags.pagetitle: 11 on 11: India defeat Pakistan at Eden, 11 WC matches, 11 wins
metatags.metadescription: Pakistan batted calmly on a tricky wicket to post 118/5 in 18 overs against India at the Eden Gardens
metatags.keywords: India vs Pakistan,World T20,Ind vs Pak Live

cricket_live_blog.display_title_landing_page: How Hardik Pandya's sensational last over helped India 'snatch victory from the jaws of defeat')
cricket_live_blog.title: How Hardik Pandya's sensational last over helped India 'snatch victory from the jaws of defeat'

details.content_title: We leave you with this video from Bengaluru. The crowd goes berserk as India clinch the thriller..

The scenes in the crowd from that last ball.. Incredible reaction! #IND #BAN #WT20 pic.twitter.com/hE5Ywh0CLF

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016

It was a nerve wrecking game. India were lucky to finish on the winning side after the blunders they made on the field. It all came down to handling the pressure at the end and who better than MS Dhoni and his boys could do it. India now have four points from two matches and they are alive.
The Indian skipper credits Bumrah and Pandya for holding their nerves and coming up with tidy overs at the death

Bowlers did a great job and we were on top till the last three balls. Anyway, it is bad luck can't do much. Last three balls was where we lost. Specially it is disappointing today. We didn't play well against Pakistan, but played two good games: Mashrafe Mortaza

I think Bumrah bowled really well, the second over he bowled, he was under pressure that was because he had not fielded well. He did well to forget that and bowl the crucial 19th over. They were cruising and we used our proper bowlers and that made a difference. Overall, very good bowling effort. There were quite a few stuff we were discussing. We didn't want Pandya to bowl the yorker, it had to be back of a length and what field should it be. His execution of the last delivery was excellent: MS Dhoni

This was the moment that won it for India! LIVE: https://t.co/MWmOXskf3t #INDvBAN #WT20 pic.twitter.com/AVWgbqnEOa

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016
Ashwin had asked Bumrah to do a mankad. Can you believe that?
He had put down a catch, he was 2 overs for 22, he was down, but Bumrah came back for us. I probably gave him a cheeky idea to try a mankad in the end. We might have taken flak, but why not?
We never really got together and worried so much, says R Ashwin. He credits the Bangladesh team for putting up a brave show
R Ashwin is the Player of the Match

What have you done Bangladesh!! India kept their cool.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016

The legend of Dhoni just grew!

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
India have beaten Bangladesh by 1 run. What a thriller this was. Bangladesh should be lauded for a spirited effort. They were almost there.. India stay alive in the tournament

19.6 overs: The record stays. MS Dhoni proves he is the master behind the stumps. Ice-cool, brilliant thinking from Dhoni. He was sane enough to think under such pressure. India maintain their T20I record against Bangladesh. IND 5 - BAN 0
19.6 overs: Is it over? Good ball from Pandya. Bowled it wide, Dhoni ran in and broke the stumps. The match boils down to a third umpire decision
The Indians are taking their time on the field..
2 from 1..
Dhoni is still making changes on the field
2 from 1, 2 from 1...

19.5 overs: OUT! Mahmudullah is gone, tried to clear the mid-wicket fence but found Jadeja in the deep. Good catch under pressure from Jadeja. 2 runs needed off 1 ball. Hardik is on-a-hat-trick now. BAN 145/8
Shuvagata Hom in at No 9. Are we going to see a super over here?
Mahmudullah has got the strike now. BAN 145/7
19.4 overs: OUT! A wicket for Pandya here. Short ball again and Mushfiqur plays a glamour short to see himself walking back to the hut. Bangladesh need two runs from two balls
19.3 overs: Four! Cheeky! Scoop shot from Mushfiqur and the balls runs past Dhoni to the fence. 2 runs from 3 balls. Musfiqur is already celebrating
Pandya can't afford to bowl these length balls
19.2 overs: Four! Length ball and Mushfiqur slaps it to the cover boundary. Six off four balls. Bangladesh are looking good to beat India for the first time in T20Is
There is a long conversation between Dhoni and Pandya.

Top over under pressure from Bumrah. Couldn't have done more for Pandya who has to bowl the last.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
19.1 overs: Single, 10 from 5
Mahmudullah on strike. He is a cool customer
Hardik Pandya to bowl the final over. 11 runs from 6 balls. Mahmudullah and Rahim at the crease - two experienced campaigners
18.6 overs: A single off the last ball. A brilliant penultimate over from Bumrah. Six runs off it. Fantastic stuff!

India have defended this total with some spirit. But the catches dropped will hurt them

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
18.5 overs: Another single, good work on the field from Rohit. 12 needed from 7 now
18.4 overs: Pitched up and another single. 13 runs from 8 balls  now. This is turning out to be a thriller
18.3 overs: Third single off the over. The third umpire checked for a run-out and Rahim was safe by an inch. BAN 133/6
18.1 overs: Yorker again, single, one run. 16 needed from 11
Dhoni has taken the gamble by asking Bumrah to bowl the 19th
Jasprit Bumrah into the attack now
Nehra is dissapointed with himself for bolwing a full-toss
17.6 overs: Four! An ice-cool Mahmuddulah pierces the off-side field to bring down India's hopes. Bangladesh now need 17 off 12. It's pressure on India now. BAN 130/6
Mushfiqur Rahim walks in for Bangladesh..
17.5 overs: OUT! Nehra bowls a full-toss but Sarkar slaps it straight to Virat Kohli at long on. The left-hander departs for 21. Crucial wicket this for India. BAN 126/6, need 21 from 13 balls
17.2 overs: Pitched short and Sarkar slaps it to the mid-wicket fence. Another boundary. Bangladesh need 23 from 16 balls
17.1 overs: Nehra to continue
Bumrah has been so consistent with his yorkers in the death. It now has given Dhoni hope to give one more to the battered bowler
16.6 overs: Brilliant over from Jasprit Bumrah. An over filled with yorkers. 7 runs off it. BAN 120/5
The fans are rooting for the home side now

Wicket falling. #slowmotion #WT20 pic.twitter.com/JAo8shdZwj

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016
16.1 overs: Two runs off Bumrah's first ball. A not-so-brisk effort from Yuvraj costs an extra run
Jasprit Bumrah back into the attack. He has conceded 19 runs from his 2 overs
15.6 overs: Nine runs off Jadeja's over. Three runs after the six off the first ball. BAN need 34 from 24. BAN 113/5
`15.1 overs: SIX! Soumya Sarkar this time. Bangladesh are cruising here.
14.6 overs: Good over from the veteran pacer. Five runs off it. The asking rate is slowly climbing up. BAN 104/5
14.5 overs: One run, could have been more if not for Jadeja. This man has been brilliant on the field today. BAN 104/5
That was a class act from Ashwin. He should have got a couple more there
Ashish Nehra back into the attack, a crucial over this for both the teams
13.6 overs: Tight over from Jadeja. Three runs off it. Bangladesh need 48 from 36 now. BAN 99/5
Jadeja from the other end
12.6 overs: Brilliant over from Ashwin. One run and  a wicket off it. Four dot balls after the wicket fell. Ashwin finishes with 4-0-20-2. The pressure back on Bangladesh. BAN 96/5
12.1 overs: OUT! Big blow for Bangladesh. Ashwin removes Shakib Al Hasan, compromises for his drop catch. A beautiful ball from the off-spinner. Took the edge and landed in Raina's hands. BAN 95/5
11.6 overs: Eight off the over. Shakib is making the chase look simple here. The pitch has eased out a bit and the left-hander is making full use of it. BAN 95/4
11.4 overs: SIX! Shakib isn't holding back. This one was hit neatly into the stands. The equation now is 54 from 51. BAN 94/4
Mahmudullah walks in. Bangladesh have two experienced men in the middle. Crucial pair this for Bangladesh. India would be happy to see them walking back soon
India are hanging around, thanks to Jadeja's srike, They need to improve their efforts on the field to stand a chance here..
11.1 overs: OUT! Jadeja gets one more, removes Mashrafe Mortaza. The skipper's move hasn't worked out well. BAN 87/4
10.5 overs: SIX! Shakib is doing more damage. He flicks one into the mid-wicket stands. India are looking shocked. The crowd has gone mute. BAN 87/3
10.4 overs: Jadeja hits the stumps and appeals. It's an easy decision for the third umpire. Shakib is safe. BAN 81/3

10.3 overs: Dropped! Another one, India are dropping the game away here. This time it's Ashwin in the deep. An easy catch, the ball popped off the off-spinner's hands. India have been poor on the field today
Hardik back into the attack. He conceded 11 runs off his first over
The equation looks simple for Bangladesh now. They need 70 from 60 balls
10 overs: Bangladesh are scoring at 7.7 runs an over at the half-way mark. Bangladesh are looking set for causing an upset here. India need more wickets here.
9.5 overs: SIX! Mashrafe Mortaza comes down the wicket and hits one straight back Raina's head. The skipper is looking determined and pumped up. He wants to make a statement here. BAN 77/3
Mashrafe Mortaza comes in. Wise move this?

9.2 overs: OUT! Huge wicket this and it comes out of nowhere. Sabbir Rahman goes for 26. Suresh Raina gets the wicket. The credit should go the superman behind the stumps - MS Dhoni. He was alert and clipped the bails off when Sabbir just lost his balance. Replays showed the batsman's foot was on air when the bails flashed. BAN 69/3
Suresh Raina into the attack
8.6 overs: A dot-ball to end the over. Bangladesh are 67/2 in 9 overs. India need to cut down their scoring rate to stand a chance here. The match is heading Bangladesh's way
8.5 overs: Four! Again, edged again and it flies to the other side of the 'V'. Bangladesh are moving ahead here. Pandya is frustrated. BAN 67/2
8.4 overs: Four! Pandya bangs it in short and there is no fielder to stop the top-edge from Sabbir. BAN 63/2

Tricky. Have to bowl really well.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
Hardik Pandya into the attack. A medium pacer on this wicket?
8 overs: End of Jadeja's successful first over. BAN 56/2
Shakib Al Hasan into the attack. India need to get a few more here. Bangladesh have quite a few experienced batsmen to come

7.4 overs: OUT! Relief for India as Tamim walks back for 35. Jadeja strikes. The left-hander danced down the track and completely missed the ball and Dhoni is too good to offer Tamim an extra life BAN 55/2
7.1 overs: Jadeja into the attack. He needs to play an important role if India are thinking of staying alive in the tournament
Has the pitch eased off a little bit? These two batsmen are scoring at will

Sabbir Rahman has already hit 18 off 10. He is a dangerous batsman for Bangladesh. This partnership is already worth 42 runs off 28 balls. These two have scored at almost 10 runs an over. Nothing going India's way now. BAN are 53/1 off 7 overs.
6.1 overs Ashwin into the attack. Dhoni is forced to use his main-man here.. This has been a horrible first-six overs for India
Not been Bumrah's night so far. Conceded a boundary off the first ball, dropped Tamim and now 16 runs off the sixth over.
5.6 overs: Four! Another one. Tamim is ruthless against Bumrah here. BAN 45/0
5.5 overs: Four! poor bowling from Bumrah. This kid looks devastated now. Tamim gets an edge and the ball flies to the third-man boundary. IND 41/1
5.3 overs: Four! Tamim is hurting Bumrah more, smashes this one straight over the bowlers head. BAN 37/1
Bumrah to continue
Tamim has got two lives today. It might prove very costly for Team India today. Bumrah has been pathetic on the field today. BAN are 29/1 in 5 overs
4.6 overs: SIX! And there is the icing on the cake for Bangladesh. Ashwin drops it short and Sabbir deposits it into the mid-wicket stand
4.4 overs: Dropped! Bumrah can't get an easier chance than this, drops a sitter. Tamim gets a life.
Ashwin to continue..
Nehra has been a bit inconsistent today. He has conceded 15 from his two overs.
3.6 overs: Eight runs off Nehra's second over. BAN 20/1

2.6 overs: End of a very successful over from Ashwin - 2 runs and a wicket. The last two balls should have sent warning bells to the Bangladesh dug out. Ashwin landed it on the perfect spot and troubled Tamim. Sabbir into the new batsman now
The senior men's hockey team is at the Chinnaswamy stadium in Bengaluru cheering for Mahendra Singh Dhoni's men

#WT20 Men: Special BCCI Invitees - the @TheHockeyIndia members pic.twitter.com/VoOhCyswDL

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
Hardik Pandya is all pumped up. A good effort from the all-rounder there on the field, the bowling change has worked for India
2.2 overs: OUT! Ashwin doesn't take long to strike. Mithun tries to clear the long on boundary but Hardik Pandya takes a stunning catch. Mithun goes for 1. BAN 11/1
And there is Ravichandran Ashwin, Dhoni cannot resist using him on this track anymore
1.6 overs: Bumrah concedes just three runs and finishes a splendid over. BAN 9/0
1.4 overs: Bumrah has bowled three dot balls already
Dot balls are important for India to create pressure. The target is not big enough to concede easy singles.
1.1 overs: Bumrah to bowl the second over. No spin early on from India today
1 overs: Seven runs off the first over. Not a good start on the field for Team India
0.5 overs: Dropped! That was a chance for Nehra. Tamim slammed it back at him and Nehra couldn't hold on to it. BAN 6/0
0.2 overs: Tamim is back on his foot.

0.1 overs: Four! Shabby work on the field from Jasprit Bumrah, conceded three extra runs. Ashish Nehra, ball-watching, bumps into Tamim. The Bangladesh batsman goes down. The game has been stopped for a while now
Welcome back, the Bangladesh openers are making their way into the middle. Team India skipper MS Dhoni is having a brief chat with his men near the boundary rope
Mashrafe Mortaza has to be lauded for using his resources well. The Bangladesh bowlers have restricted India to an achievable total on this track.
44 dot balls were bowled by the Bangladesh bowlers. That's almost half of the innings. Is it going to cost Team India?

Seems Bangladesh read the pitch better than the home team this time. The Indian batsmen threw their wickets away at crucial stages in the innings. They should have got ten more runs. However, Bangladesh have to spot on with the bat to chase 147 on this track

87 runs were scored in the last 10 overs. Decent effort from Suresh Raina and Hardik Pandya has taken India to a competitive total. Nevertheless, Mashrafe Mortaza was brilliant with his field placings and bowling changes
20 overs: Another yorker from Mustafizur. Dhoni gets a double this time. India finish with 146/7.
19.5 overs: Dhoni hits one straight to the mid-off fielder. Denies a single
19.3 overs: Single from Ashwin. The crowd is roaring, Dhoni back on strike
19.2 overs: Four! Ashwin makes Mustafizur pay for bowling one down the leg. He gets a boundary off his first ball. IND 141/7

19.1 overs: OUT! Mustafizur cleans up Jadeja. A faster one from the left-arm bowler and Jadeja was beaten for pace. Jadeja goes for 12. IND 137/7. More importantly, Dhoni remains at the non-striker's end

Bangladesh have used the conditions beautifully. Have to say they are ahead at this stage.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
18.6 overs: 14 runs off the over. One over left for Team India. Can they get to 150. It's Mustafizur for Bangladesh. IND 137/6
18.5 overs: Four! Good shot from Jadeja once again, good placement yet again. This time he works a slow bouncer to the backward square leg boundary. Two in two for Jadeja. IND 136/6
18.4 overs: Four! Jadeja makes room for himself and beautifully places it past the point fielder. Much needed runs these for India. IND 132/6
18.2 overs: Four! Dhoni does it in his own style. He almost swings himself off his feet to hit a boundary through the covers. IND 127/6
18.1 overs: Make that 42. Al Amin bowls another good yorker
India have played out 41 dot ball in this innings so far. The Bangladesh bowlers have been brilliant with yorkers today
17.6 overs: A yorker to end a fantastic over. Mustafizur has been brilliant today. Only five runs off the 18 th over. India are getting themselves into a danger situation here. IND 123/6
17.5 overs: Mahendra Singh Dhoni brings up 1000 T20I runs with a single. The Indian skipper has taken 66 matches to get there. He hasn't scored a fifty in T20I cricket so far.

Another blinder from Soumya Sarkar. Has to be among the better deep catchers in the game.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
17.3 overs: Mustafizur is mixing it up well - slower balls, yorkers. Jadeja is not able to hit the big ones. Three runs of the first three so far. IND 121/6
The pitch report these days are just a joke. Tom Moody at the pitch assessment earlier today said the ball would come on to the bat nicely. And look at what has happened now
Mustafizur into the attack. He is generally good at the death. He has two over left here
17 overs: Four runs off Mahmudullah's over. Mashrafe should be happy. India are not being wise here, losing wickets in a hurry. IND 118/6
16.5 overs: OUT! Yuvraj played a nothing shot to walk back to the pavillion. Mahmudullah-move has worked in favour of Bangladesh. IND 117/6
16.1 overs: Dhoni gets a single and the left-hander Yuvraj to face the off-spinner. Mahmudullah will be happy to bowl at Yuvraj
Mahmudullah into the attack. Dhoni is having the strike. Brave move from Mashrafe

15.6 overs: Three dot balls to end a highly successful over. Indian batsmen have not been wise with their shot selection today. They need to get to 140 to give something for their bowlers. Bangladesh have done very well with the ball and on the field so far. IND 114/5
15.3 overs: No hat-trick for Al Amin. Yuvraj tucks the ball off his pads to get a two. IND 114/5
Pandya didn't have to play that shot. However, he was in the mood to go after everything
Yuvraj to face the hat-trick ball

15.2 overs: OUT! Stunning catch in the deep from Soumya Sarkar to dismiss the dangerous Pandya. Al Amin on-a-hat-trick now. Pandya tried to hit one to the mid-wicket fence but Sarkar takes a brilliant one-handed catch to end Pandya's cameo
Skipper Dhoni walks in
Looking at the way the game has progressed so far, it's fair to say Raina has played a good part here. 30 off 23 is not bad at all on this track
15.1 overs: OUT! Suresh Raina falls for a short ball again. He tries to hit a big one off Al Amin but succumbs. IND 112/4
Pandya is doing what he was expected to do. 15 runs from 6 balls so far.
14.6 overs: Four! Pandya at it again. This time he comes down the track and smashes it to the cover boundary. IND 112/3
14.5 overs: Four! Pandya is in the mood to hit the big ones here. Hits one straight down the ground. IND 108/3
14.2 overs: Pandya to face Shakib
Important for Pandya to continue hitting the big ones. A cameo from him might prove too valuable for the team. The young man has got the backing from the skipper.
13.6 overs: SIX! Pandya into the action straightaway. Hits a big six to finish an eventful over. IND 101/3
MS Dhoni has a surprise! He has sent Pandya in at No 5

13.4 overs: OUT! Big wicket for Bangladesh. Shuvagata snares Kohli. The right-hander played it across the line and paid for it. That was a quicker one from the off-spinner. Chinnaswamy has been muted now. IND 95/3
13.3 overs: SIX! First boundary for Virat Kohli. Shuvagata bolwed a full-toss. Kohli deposits into the mid-wicket stands
13.1 overs: Four! Much needed for India. Raina comes down the track and hits it straight. Pressure on Shuvagata IND 88/2
Shakib has been brilliant. He is focused on firing in the yorkers to both the batsmen. India are now scoring at a rate of 6.46. They should push the scoring rate up
12.6 overs: Five runs from the over. Shakib did very well to keep Kohli and Raina quiet. IND 84/2
12.3 overs: Suresh Raina has changed his bat again. A heavier one this time? The bowlers are not giving any pace for the batsmen to work with here. Clever from Bangladesh
12.1 overs: Shakib Al Hasan to continue. He has conceded seven runs from his 2 overs
11.6 overs: Another tidy over from Mortaza. He has kept the pressure on the Indian batsmen. IND 79/2
11.1 overs: Mortaza continues with the keeper standing up to the stumps
10.6 overs: 14 runs off the over. Raina is slowly finding his timing. It's important he gets into the groove. IND 73/2
10.5 overs: SIX! Two in two. Deposits one into the mid-wicket stand again. It was timed better this time. IND 73/2
10.4 overs: SIX! First boundary in 30 balls, Raina clips one off his hips into the mid-wicket stands. IND 67/2
10.2 overs: Dropped! Al Amin puts down one off Virat Kohli. Tough chance. Tried it with one hand. There was no timing on the shot. He should have taken it
10.1 overs: Al Amin into the attack

Bangladesh bowlers have made use of the conditions on offer well. India lost two wickets in the first ten overs and are struggling to get going. A good stand between these two in the middle is a necessity for Team India now
9.6 overs: Raina mistimes once again. Lucky again, gets a single. 7 runs from the tenth over. IND 59/2
9.5 overs: The wicketkeeper is standing up to prevent Virat walking down the track. He gets a single though
Look at Virat Kohli on this track, the difference between Raina and Kohli's battting. The latter looks completely in control
9.3 overs: Mashrafe Mortaza completely deceives Suresh Raina with a slower ball. Lucky Raina didn't find a fielder.
Virat Kohli's T20I average reads 53.6. The second-placed Aaron Finch has an average of 39.8. India need this man to fire today
"India need to calm down," says Sanjay Manjrekar. India are 52/2 at the end of nine overs. Bangladesh have conceded only 10 runs in the last three overs. Pressure on India now.
How much should India score on this track. The ball is holding up a bit. 150-160 may be?
8.1 overs: The off-spinner Shuvagata into the attack now
Bangladesh have not let India get off to a flyer. They have picked up two wickets early in the innings. A lot of bowling changes from skipper Mortaza
7.6 overs: Mashrafe was spot on in the last over. Four runs and three dot balls off it. This has been a shaky start for India. IND 49/2
7.1 overs: Mashrafe Mortaza continues..
Both the openers are back in the hut now. The onus once again is on Virat Kohli. Can he deliver today? Suresh Raina has joined the right-hander
6.6 overs: OUT! Shikhar Dhawan walks back to hut for 23. It was full delivery from Shakib and it hit Dhawan on the foot. Looked out. The umpire though took a long time to raise his finger. IND 45/2
Virat Kohli is the new man in. Shakib is continuing. A good reception for the Royal Challengers Bangalore skipper
That over from Mustafizur went for 15 runs but he was able to pick up the big wicket of Rohit

5.6 overs: OUT! Not good thinking from Rohit Sharma. Tries to hit the third six in the over that already saw them scoring 15 runs. He tries to hit one to the mid-wicket boundary, gets a top edge and Sabbir Rahman takes an easy catch. India lose their first wicket. IND 42/1
5.4 overs: SIX! It's Dhawan this time. He was able to pick up a slower one from Mustafizur and deposit into the mid-wicket stands. The ball travelled 83 m. IND 41/0
It's noisy out there at Chinnaswamy stadium
5.2 overs: SIX! Rohit is taking up the task of accelerating. He hits one straight over Mustafizur's head. IND 34/0
Will this slow start have an effect in the outcome of the match?
5 overs: Good over from Shakib. Four runs off it. India have to accelerate here. The run-rate is less than run-a-ball now. IND 27/0
4.4 overs: Shakib nearly sent Rohit walking back. Rohit checks his shot to a slower ball from Shakib and it just fell a bit short of the left-arm spinner IND 26/0
4.1 overs: Shakib Al Hasan into the attack. Bangladesh have used five different bowlers for the first five overs. And they haven't done bad so far
3.6 overs: Four! Shikhar Dhawan spoils Mustafizur's over. He leaks a boundary of the last ball - a poor one on the pads. Dhawan flicked it to the mid-wicket boundary IND 23/0
3.5 overs: Shikhar dances down the track only to see the ball crashing into his pads. He failed to read an off-cutter from Musrafizur
3.4 overs: Bangladesh have already saved a couple of boundaries by having men at the right positions on the field. Dhawan and Rohit are being given easy singles though
3.1 overs: Mustafizur Rahman into the attack. Watch out for his slower balls, the off-cutters
3 overs: Eight runs from the last over. India should look to make good use of the powerplay. IND 17/0
2.5 overs: Quick single taken. This is good running from the two batsmen. IND 17/0
2.1 overs: Four! It's Rohit Sharma this time. Waits for the ball from Al-Amin and guides it past the point fielder. Quality shot! IND 13/0
1.4 overs: Four! Pitched short and Dhawan makes no mistake, sends it soaring to the mid-wicket boundary. IND 9/0
1.1 overs: Spin from the other end. Shuvagata Hom, the off-spinner, into the attack. And it's turning sharply straightaway
1 overs: Five runs of the first over. Four singles were taken. IND 5/0
0.4 overs: Three singles so far in the first four balls. There was a little bit of confusion in the middle between the two batsmen. IND 4/0
01. overs: Skipper Mortaza steams in with the new ball. Rohit Sharma slashes it to the deep-point fielder for just a single. Good field placement from Bangladesh IND 1/0
Stat Alert: Teams that have won the toss have gone on to win on 11 occasions out of 12 in the main round of this year's World T20 tournament

The stadium is already packed. It's a good test for Shikhar Dhawan today. He has looked out of sorts. It's important for him to get going here when there is less pressure, when the team is batting first
Mahendra Singh Dhoni didn't have the luck going his way at the toss

#BAN win the toss and will bowl first #WT20 #BANvIND pic.twitter.com/rAnDsTYbDr

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016
Tamim Iqbal is back in the Bangladesh XI. A huge boost to Bangladesh's batting today
Here's a look at the two teams
India: Rohit Sharma, Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, Yuvraj Singh, MS Dhoni(w/c), Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Ashish Nehra, Jasprit Bumrah
Bangladesh: Tamim Iqbal, Soumya Sarkar, Mohammad Mithun, Sabbir Rahman, Shakib Al Hasan, Shuvagata Hom, Mahmudullah, Mushfiqur Rahim(w), Mashrafe Mortaza(c), Al-Amin Hossain, Mustafizur Rahman
India haven't made any changes to the squad. Dhoni says the team is looking good. This is the first time India are batting first in the tournament
Mashrafe Mortaza has gone ahead trusting the stats. India are batting first here.
Bangladesh have won the toss and have opted to bowl first.

Here's Tom Moody with the pitch report: This has been one of the better batting wickets in India. The par score is 170. It is a flat surface and has a nice covering of grass, the ball will come on to the bat. Captains tend to chase here.
The average score on this track is 173. Team winning the toss have chose to field 17 times out of 19 in Bengaluru
Five minutes to the toss. The stadium is filling up slowly. A must-win for Bangladesh this. India will be better placed if they win tonight's clash
Bangladesh are definitely good with their football skills

#BAN show off some good football skills during the warm up. #BANvIND #WT20 https://t.co/1n9HW8NpH0

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016

Bangladesh will be hoping to get their star batsman Tamim Iqbal back in the side today. He missed the last game against Australia due to illness. He lit up the qualifiers with his maiden century against Oman. He will be key to Bangladesh's chances today
Skipper Mahendra Singh Dhoni is having a look at the wicket. Should India bat first or chase today? Your thoughts?

#WT20 Men: Captain @msdhoni taking a look at the pitch. #Ind play #Ban today at 1930 hrs IST pic.twitter.com/kiG9Z1ceWW

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
We're twenty minutes away from the toss. It's time for team huddle at the Chinnaswamy stadium

#WT20 Men: #TeamIndia pic.twitter.com/AA485G8qh3

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
Yuvraj Singh is gearing up for tonight's clash. He was involved in a crucial partnership with Kohli in the game against Pakistan. Will he fire today?

#WT20 Men: @YUVSTRONG12 is on his way for the warm-up pic.twitter.com/jrRyCnpBHe

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
Bangalore hasn't had any high-scoring games this tournament so far. Will there one tonight? Indian off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin inspects the pitch at he M Chinnaswamy staidum

#WT20 Men: @ashwinravi99 inspects the pitch ahead of the match against #Ban pic.twitter.com/QRzQOvfVNa

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
Virat Kohli is the leading the troupe as Team India leaves for the stadium from the team hotel in Benglauru. The man looks set for another big one. How many of you think he will?

#WT20 Men: #TeamIndia is leaving for the stadium. #Ind play #Ban today at 1930 hrs ISThttps://t.co/00ESRaAHIZ

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
We're an hour away from the toss. Will India make any changes to the team against Bangladesh today?

Bangladesh also have never won a T20I against India. The last time these two teams met was during the Asia Cup T20 final earlier this month and the Men in Blue made light work of the Bangladesh unit to clinch the title
Here's what Shakib said at the press conference yesterday

Shakib has said that his team was wary of the match-winners in the Indian line-up. Kohli, according to him, is the key player today. The star Indian batsman has been in blazing form. The match-winning 55 against Pakistan on Saturday would have boosted his confidence.
Bangladesh need their main men to fire today. Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah have to rise to the occasion if their team are thinking of causing an upset today.

Bangladesh, on the other hand, have lost two successive games and are yet to open their account at the World T20 tournament. The suspensions news of Taskin Ahmed and Arafat Sunny has shaken their unit and skipper Mashrafe Mortaza is lacking intent on the field.
India are a confident looking unit now. After losing their first game against New Zealand, they bounced back against arch-rivals are looking set for another win today in Bengaluru
Hello and Welcome to our LIVE COVERAGE of the ICC World Twenty20 clash between India and Bangladesh

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: India beat Bangladesh by 1 run in a thriller at M Chinnaswamy stadium in Bengaluru to stay alive in ICC World Twenty20. (Live Scorecard)

metatags.pagetitle: How Hardik Pandya's sensational last over helped India 'snatch victory from the jaws of defeat'
metatags.metadescription: India beat Bangladesh by 1 run in a thriller at M Chinnaswamy stadium in Bengaluru to stay alive in ICC World Twenty20.
metatags.keywords: Ind vs Ban Live,India vs Bangladesh,World T20

cricket_live_blog.title: ICC World Twenty20: India vs New Zealand, Live cricket scores

details.content_title: Here's what the star spinners Mitchell Santner had to say..

There was a bit of spin out there. The Indians bowled well to keep us to 126. We thought our total was maybe below par, but the boys stuck at it and we are delighted with the win. We knew it was going to be tough. Jadeja was really spinning it there. Starting a partnership was hard. We wanted to get to 130-140 and in the end 126 proved to be enough. I just tried to hit that hard length and kept it very simple
Black Caps make it five out of five against India. It's a big defeat for the hosts in the opening match
Mitchell Santner and Ish Sodhi took seven wickets between them and they looked unplayable. The New Zealand spinners, who have taken nine off the 10 Indian wickets, have aced the spin test in Nagpur
18.1 overs: WICKET! Ashish Nehra is the last man to fall.  IND 79/10
18 overs: End of Santner's superb spell. Four wickets for the young man including the Indian skipper's
The Indian fans in Nagpur are leaving, seems the hosts have been humbled at home
17.4 overs: WICKET! The big man departs for 30. MS Dhoni couldn't do much there. IND 79/9
17 overs: Another successful over for New Zealand. India need 52 from 18. IND 75/8
16.4 overs: Nehra in at No 10. He stays back and defends the first ball

16.3 overs: WICKET! Ish Sodhi does it beautifully, drags Ashwin forward and leaves it to Luke Ronchi to do the rest. India have lost their eighth wicket, more importantly Dhoni has lost a decent partner. IND 73/8
16.1 overs: SIX! MS Dhoni finally hits the big one. Stayed back and smashed Ish Sodhi straight over his head. IND 72/7
16 overs: India 66/7. Need 61 runs from 24 balls
15.4 overs: The boundaries have dried up. Ashwin and Dhoni have stitched a 22-run partnership but the pace at which the runs came has worried India.
14.4 overs: MS Dhoni senses the opportunity for a second after nudging the ball towards the mid-wicket fielder. R Ashwin had to put in a dive to complete two there..

Spinners from New Zealand beating India in India. The world is genuinely flat!

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 15, 2016
14.1 overs: Ish Sodhi continues..
14 overs: Ind 57/7. They need 70 runs from 36 balls. New Zealand clearly on top at this stage
Kane Williamson is attacking with more fielders inside the ring. MS Dhoni is not getting enough singles. It's huge pressure on India's skipper. He's been there, done that. Can he do it tonight?

13 overs: India 53/7. The required run rate has gone past 10 an over. India's total of 42/6 at the end of 10 overs was their worst performance in the first half of the innings in all T20I internationals. Not the record Dhoni and his men wanted to create in the World T20 opener at home.
The New Zealand spinners have been terrific on this wicket. Mitchell Santner and Ish Sodhi have rocked the Indian batting order.
12 overs: India reeling at 49/7. They still need 78 off 48 balls. MS Dhoni is still there at the crease. Did New Zealand read the pitch better? IND 49/7
10.2 overs: WICKET! Jadeja falls, India in big, big trouble. Ish Sodhi strikes again. No Indian batsman has so far played with  soft bat. IND 43/7
10 overs: India 42/6, chasing 127 vs New Zealand. Can Dhoni and Jadeja turn the match on its head with another half of their innings left? Equation: 85 off 10 overs
9.4 overs: WICKET! Santner has picked his third, removes Pandya, who looked all at sea against some top-quality spin in Nagpur. India 42/6 as Jadeja joins Dhoni in the middle
9 overs: Excellent over from Ish Sodhi; he snared Kohli and conceded only two runs. India need a Dhoni special now
8.1 overs: Ish Sodhi strikes off his first ball and he has has the WICKET of VIRAT KOHLI! Wow, this is serious trouble for India here. Hardik Pandya has joined Dhoni in the middle
8 overs: Another good over from Elliott, six off it. India 39/4 chasing 127
7 overs: Kohli and Dhoni are going to do it in singles now. That's all they need to do really. India 33/4
6.5 overs: Three runs conceded by Milne so far.
6.1 overs: Kohli plays the Free Hit straight to the fielder and Dhoni was almost run-out at the non-striker's end.
6.1 overs; New Zealand's fastest bowler Adam Milne in action and he starts with a no-ball. FREE HIT for Kohli
6 overs: Good work from part-timer Grant Elliott; India 29/4 chasing 127 at the end of the Powerplay
5 overs: India 26/4. All the focus will now be on Virat Kohli and MS Dhoni, two of India's best finishers in limited-overs cricket
4.5 overs: WICKET! Disaster for India! Yuvraj Singh falls to McCullum for 4. They are chasing 127 and the pitch is not really easy to bat on. Dhoni joins Kohli in the middle
4.4 overs: FOUR! Yuvraj has looked good lately and he will be dangerous here. He looks determined
4.1 overs: Nathan McCullum to continue. All eyes on Kohli yet again.
3.4 overs: FOUR! Kohli does this so well and he does that time and again. Is this the start of another of those famous counterattacks?
3.1 overs: FOUR! Kohli played that really late and the ball shot away to the ropes like a tracer bullet
3 overs: Yuvraj Singh walks in to join Virat Kohli in the middle. He plays out a dot ball
2.5 overs: WICKET! India are in a spot of bother here as Santner strikes again, to remove the dangerous Suresh Raina. India 12/3

2.2 overs: WICKET! And a big one at that. Santner removes Rohit Sharma, who played a silly shot under the circumstances. He was nowhere near the line of the ball and missed it totally only for Ronchi to complete an easy stumping
2.1 overs: Mitchell Santner in the attack for the Kiwis.
1.4 overs: So far a good over from Anderson - only three runs off it so far.
1.1 overs: Corey Anderson in the attack and Kohli clips it away for two - good shot that. India could be in business if Kohli plays another of his masterclass on this tough batting wicket
1 over: New man in Virat Kohli off the mark with a single as India reach 6/1 chasing 127 vs New Zealand
0.5 over: WICKET! McCullum traps Dhawan lbw early in the piece. That's a big blow for India, who have relied on explosive starts from the southpaw over the last few weeks
0.4: Rohit plays a lovely shot there, good placement. Elliott did well to save a certain boundary but these two run three
0.1 over: Indian openers Rohit and Dhawan in the middle. Nathan McCullum to Rohit and he's off the mark with a single
20 overs: Great work from India's bowlers. Nehra had bowled his first two overs for five runs but gave away 15 in his third. NZ 126/7, thanks to some initiative by Luke Ronchi
19.5 overs: SIX! Ronchi hammers that into the stands. Much, much needed runs for the Kiwis
19.3 overs: WICKET! Grant Elliott is run-out, thank to a good, flat throw from Dhawan. All Nehra had to do was disturb the stumps. NZ 114/7
19.1 overs: Nehra to bowl the final over.
19 overs: Jadeja finishes with 1/26 from his four overs as New Zealand reach 111/6 vs India
18.3 overs: FOUR! Ronchi dispatches that towards extra-cover. NZ needed those runs.
18.1 overs: Jadeja back in the attack for his final over and an unsuccessful appeal for stumping against Elliott.
18 overs: Bumrah finishes with 4-0-15-1; just give runs off his last over as New Zealand reach 103/6
17.1 overs: Bumrah to bowl this one - that means Nehra will not bowl his quota of overs.
17 overs: Jadeja finishes the over off well. New Zealand 98/6 and they have two overs from Nehra and one from Bumrah to face in their innings
16.4 overs: WICKET! Santner had just struck Jadeja for a boundary but he needed to go again. This time he failed and top-edged only for Dhoni to complete an easy catch
16 overs: That was the kind of over that should make any Indian proud. It was studded with yorkers. NZ 90/5
15.4 overs: WICKET! Bumrah removes Anderson as the middle-stump goes flying. Jamtha erupts as NZ slip to 89/5
15.3 overs: Great yorker from Bumrah.
15.1 overs: Bumrah back in the attack for his final spell.
15 overs:  That was an expensive over from Pandya. Ten runs off it as NZ reach 88/4 with five overs left in their innings
14.2 overs: FOUR! Quick delivery from Pandya but beautifully picked off the pads by Santner. Much-needed runs for the Black Caps
14.1 overs: Hardik Pandya in the attack, replacing Jadeja. Come on New Zealand, where's the fire?
14 overs: Top spell from Raina. 4-0-16-1. Three runs off his last over. NZ 78/4 with six overs left
13.1 overs: Raina is going to bowl out here. He has been unbelievable with the ball tonight.
13 overs: Expensive over from Jadeja because he tried to bowl a leg-side line and ended up dishing out a few wides. NZ 75/4
12.2 overs: Second successive wide down the leg-side from Jadeja. And Dhoni is in trouble as the ball caught him on the left hand
12.1 overs: Four byes. That one from Jadeja beat everyone - Santner and 'keeper Dhoni.
11.3 overs: WICKET! Sensational work from Raina. Anderson played it back to Raina, who showed devilishly quick reflexes to run Ross Taylor out at the bowler's end. NZ 61/4
11 overs: Excellent over from Jadeja - just four runs off it. New Zealand survived that one dangerously to reach 59/3
10.1 overs: Ravindra Jadeja in the attack.
10 overs: New Zealand 55/3 as Ashwin  bowls out his quota of overs half-way through the Kiwi innings
9.4 overs :FOUR! Beautiful touch bu Taylor, plays it late and picks important runs against Ashwin
9.1 overs: Ashwin back in the attack and he will bowl out here. Anderson pushes it away for a single as New Zealand bring up their fifty
9 overs: Raina concedes seven off his second over as New Zealand reach 49/2. Dhoni wouldn't mind that. He still has four overs from Jadeja up his sleeves.

Sea of BLUE in Nagpur for #Ind vs. #NZ at #WT20 pic.twitter.com/TEJDlAHVrF

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 15, 2016
8.1 overs: Raina to bowl his second over. Harsha Bhogle says that's a bonus for India.
8 overs: Seven runs off the over eventually. New Zealand are 42/3 and they need a serious push from one of either Anderson or Taylor
7.4 overs: Good work from Bumrah again - just five runs off the over so far. Can he finish it off well for India?
7.1 overs: Bumrah to continue. New Zealand really need a move-on here.
7 overs: Ross Taylor in the middle with Anderson with New Zealand struggling at 35/3 vs India.

6.5 overs: WICKET! Williamson steps down the wicket to play a nothing shot against Raina and Dhoni completes an easy stumping. The pressure was created by Bumrah in the last over and all Raina had to do was keep the heat up NZ 35/3
6.1 overs: Suresh Raina in the attack. Williamson pulls away a short delivery but gets only a single
6 overs: What an over from Bumrah. Just one run off it. New Zealand 33/2 at the end of the batting powerplay
5.4 overs: Bumrah has been on the spot so far. Four dot-balls. Pressure back on the hard-hitting Kiwis
5.1 overs: Bumrah in the attack, replaces Nehra. He is up against two of the most dangerous batsmen in world cricket
5 overs: Corey Anderson smashes his second boundary in the over, New Zealand reach 32/2. Ashwin leaks 10 runs in his third over
4.1 overs: Ashwin to bowl his third over here. What's Dhoni thinking here?
3.1 overs: Nehra to continue. India have to be on their toes here against a dangerous Corey Anderson and a brilliant Kane Williamson,
2 overs: Fantastic over from Nehra, who concedes only a single and prizes the key wicket of Colin Munro. NZ 14/2
1.3 overs: WICKET! Ooh, New Zealand are off to a nervous start here. Munro stared Nehra down a few seconds back but then plays him straight to Hardik Pandya inside the ring. NZ 13/2
1.2 overs: Two dot- balls. So far so good for Nehra
1.1 overs: Ashish Nehra in the attack. He has been sensational for India this year. What a big moment this is for him
1 over: New Zealand 13/1 off the first over
0.4 over: SIX! Colin Munro walks out to the middle and gets off the mark with a SIX! Terrific cricket from the Black Caps. Brendon McCullum may have retired but they are still playing to his spirit.
0.2 over: WICKET! Ashwin traps Guptill plumb in front of the wickets. Jamtha erupts. NZ 6/1
0.1 over: Ashwin with the first ball of the match. Massive noise from the home-crowd. SIX! Guptill has hammered that into the stands
R Ashwin to start proceedings for India.
There was a tribute to Martin Crowe played on the big screen
Time for national anthems in Nagpur
We're ten minutes away from the start of the ICC Word T20 2016 opener. The VCA stadium is packed

Jasprit Bumrah and Ravichandran Ashwin are the men to watch out for in the first innings. The new-ball bowlers have been very effective for Team India so far. How will the New Zealand batsmen tackle them?

ONE TEAM, ONE NATION #Ind ... ONE DREAM - The journey begins #WT20 #??????? pic.twitter.com/qgSLp2uljL

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 15, 2016
Here are the playing XIs
India: Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, Yuvraj Singh, MS Dhoni(w/c), Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Ashish Nehra, Jasprit Bumrah
New Zealand: Kane Williamson(c), Martin Guptill, Colin Munro, Ross Taylor, Corey Anderson, Grant Elliott, Luke Ronchi(w), Mitchell Santner, Nathan McCullum, Adam Milne, Ish Sodhi
"It's a 50-50 call," says Mahendra Singh Dhoni. The skipper believes the wicket won't change much during the course of the game
"We will have a bat. It is a dry surface and we will make first use of it and then use our spinners," says New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson
TOSS: New Zealand win toss and have decided to bat first.
MS Dhoni The Untold Story teaser out: Watch Sushant Singh Rajput play Captain Cool

We're ten minutes away from the toss in Nagpur. PITCH REPORT: Scott Styris expects the spinners to have a field-day today. "There is not a lot of bounce, tough to score runs on this track," says the former New Zealand cricketer.
Virat Kohli is showing a straight bat. Will the star Indian batsman continue his brilliant run?

.@imVkohli sets the ball rolling as #Ind take on #NZ later today #WT20 pic.twitter.com/hyfGJVJUqo

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 15, 2016
India women have begun their campaign on a high! They thrashed Bangladesh women by 72 runs at M Chinnaswamy stadium in Bengaluru

#Ind Women beat #Ban Women by 72 runs at #WT20 pic.twitter.com/RoZkP1cEhe

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 15, 2016
FYI, India have never beaten New Zealand in a T20I match before. Can India break the jinx in Nagpur today?
New Zealand players have been part of the Indian Premier League are they are aware of the sub-continent conditions
New Zealand are not to be taken lightly. Even without their dynamic leader Brendon McCullum, the Williamson-led side looks formidable.
The Indian team have been widely touted as firm favourites to win the tournament due to their knowledge about the conditions at home and a strong run of form in the buildup to the tournament.
Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the ICC World Twenty20 opener between hosts India and New Zealand

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: New Zealand have won the toss and have opted to bat first against India in the opening game of the ICC World Twenty20 at the Vidarbha Cricket Association stadium in Nagpur. (Live Scores)

metatags.pagetitle: ICC World Twenty20: India vs New Zealand, Live cricket scores
metatags.metadescription: An in-form India take on Kane Williamson led-New Zealand in the opener of the ICC World Twenty20 at the Vidarbha Cricket Association stadium in Nagpur.
metatags.keywords: Ind vs NZ live scores,ICC World Twenty20

cricket_live_blog.display_title_landing_page: MS Dhoni's quickfire nails Bangladesh in Asia Cup final)
cricket_live_blog.title: MS Dhoni's quickfire nails Bangladesh in Asia Cup final

details.content_title: Virat Kohli remained unbeaten on 41 with MS Dhoni finishing off the match in style by scoring a 6-ball 20.

13.5 overs: Dhoni needed two sixes and a four to seal the match for India in style. India chased down Bangladesh's target of 121 runs to beat the hosts by 8 wickets. This is India's sixth Asia Cup title.
13.1 overs: Six. Dhoni smokes it over midwicket. Great strike that.
MS Dhoni is the new batsman at the crease.
12.4 overs: Out. Taskin Ahmed strikes, scalps Dhawan for 60 caught by Soumya Sarkar at backward point. India need 22 off 14 balls.
11.6 overs: Nasir Hossain after getting through two tidy overs goes for runs in his last over. India are in complete control and need 24 off 18 balls.
10.6 overs: Shikhar Dhawan rises to the occasion by notching up his second T20I fifty off 35 balls. 11 runs from this over with India 82/1.
8.6 overs: Good comeback from Mortaza after getting for a six. India 68 for 1 and need 53 to win off 36 balls.
8.3 overs: Six. Dhawan moves across to off and swings it over fine leg. Great shot.
6.6 overs: The momentum has finally shifted in India's favour as Kohli and Dhawan bring up the 50-run partnership. India 55/1.
Mashrafe Mortaza comes on to bowl.
5.6 overs: Not an ideal start for Shakib, goes for 15 runs which included three hits to the fence. India 48/1. Dhawan and Kohli settling down well and more importantly looking to score.
5.3 overs: Four. Dhawan makes some room and plays the late cut well wide of short third man.
5.1 overs: Four. Short from Shakib and Kohli puts it away to midwicket.
Shakib Al Hasan into the attack.
4.6 overs: Abu Hider goes for runs, concedes 14 runs. Has India broken the shackles? India 33/1 with Kohli and Dhawan at the crease.
4.4 overs: Four. Kohli takes on Hider, plays over mid-off fielder.
Left-arm fast medium bowler Abu Hider into the attack.
3.6 overs: India not finding it easy to score the runs. On the other hand, the Bangladesh bowlers have done well to keep the visitors under the pump. India 19/1.

Loved the way Mahmudullah played?Some outstanding shots & his biggest strength is his ability 2 hit boundaries of good deliveries#AsiaCup

— VVS Laxman (@VVSLaxman281) March 6, 2016
1.6 overs: Bangladesh have put India on the backfoot as Al_amin gets through a really tight over by giving three runs and taking a wicket. India 8/1.
1.3 overs: Out. Al-Amin Hossain strikes to scalp Rohit Sharma for 1 caught in the slips. India 5/1.
Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan are out in the middle for the chase of 121. Taskin Ahmed starts the bowling proceedings.
14.6 overs: Jasprit Bumrah gets through a brilliant last over, by giving only 7 runs as Bangladesh post 120 for 5 on the board. Mahmudullah starred for the hosts with an unbeaten 13-ball 33.
Jasprit Bumrah comes on to bowl the last over.
13.6 overs: Mahmudullah turns the tide for Bangladesh with those lusty blows. 21 runs from Pandya's over. BAN 113/5.
13.4 overs: Six. Mahmudullah muscles it over long on, Pandya facing the heat.
Mahmudullah taking Pandya to the cleaners, hits him for two successive boundaries. BAN 102/5
12.6 overs: Nehra concedes a big over, 14 off it. Bangladesh going on well in the death overs. BAN 92/5.

R Jadeja is a very good fielder inside the circle but in my view he has to hit the stumps more often to be counted among the best https://twitter.com/hashtag/Asiacup?src=hash">#Asiacup

— Mohammad Kaif (@KaifSays) https://twitter.com/KaifSays/status/706510843228196864">March 6, 2016
11.4 overs: Out. Mortaza comes and goes. Trying to go after Jadeja holes out in long on.
11.3 overs: Out. Mushfiqur is run out here, brilliant throw from Kohli. The batsman had made his ground but the bat bounce after he made the dive.
Looks like Mushfiqur Rahim is struggling here. Bat maybe in the air
10.6 overs: Brilliant over from Pandya, just three runs given. Indian bowlers have done well so far and can't afford to give away runs in the remaining four overs. BAN 71/3.
Ashwin got through his spell of three overs with figures of 1 for 14.
9.1 overs: Out. Shakib perishes going for the big shot, caught at short fine leg for 21.
7.6 overs: Poor stuff from Pandya, concedes 11 runs, which included two boundaries. BAN 58/2.
7.4 overs: Four. Pandya digs it short and Shakib takes the challenge by pulling it to square leg.
Hardik Pandya into the attack.
6.6 overs: Good over for Bangladesh, two boundaries off it. BAN 46/2.
6.3 overs: Four. Shakib Al Hasan gives himself some room and pulls Jadeja to midwicket region.
Sabbir Rahman and Shakib Al Hasan at the crease now. Bangladesh are 35 for 2 in 6 overs.
Ashwin back into the attack.
4.4 overs: Out. Bumrah traps Tamim Iqbal lbw for 13. The umpire takes his time before raising his finger, the ball was surely hitting the stumps.
3.6 overs: Out. Nehra makes a great comeback by snaring out Soumya Sarkar for 14 caught at mid-off. The batsman trying to go over the mid-off doesn't get the timing well. BAN 27/1.
3.5 overs: Four. Short from Nehra and Soumya Sarkar pulls it well to fine leg.
3.4 overs: Four. What a shot that was from Soumya Sarkar, almost took the non-striker batsman down.
3 overs: Three runs off Bumrah's over. He was angling the ball into the batsmen. Good stuff from the young pacer. BAN 14/0
2.4 overs: Bumrah has been spot on. Sarkar is finding it difficult to score runs off him BAN 12/0
2.1 overs: First bowling change. Jasprit Bumrah into the attack. Three bowlers in three overs
2 overs: Nehra was able to comeback well after conceding a boundary off his first ball. BAN 11/0

Gr8 to c the match starting after a heavy downpour&full credit should be given 2 the head of groundstaff Gamini Silva & his team ? #AsiaCup

— VVS Laxman (@VVSLaxman281) March 6, 2016
The crowd is cheering the home side. Electric atmosphere this!
1.1 overs: Poor start from Ashish Nehra. Tamim Iqbal thrashes one to the fine-leg boundary BAN 9/0
1 overs: Five runs off the first over. Soumy Sarkar finishes the over with a beautiful cover drive BAN 5/0
0.4 overs: Four dot balls on the trot. Good effort from Ashwin. A lot of wrong'uns there
The atmosphere at the Shere Bangla Stadium is electric. The crowd is loud
Ashwin to open the bowling for India
The umpires are making their way into the field
This fifteen-over game will be interesting. Bangladesh will have a better chance in a shorter game. What say guys?
Bangladesh: Tamim Iqbal, Soumya Sarkar, Sabbir Rahman, Mushfiqur Rahim(w), Shakib Al Hasan, Mahmudullah, Nasir Hossain, Mashrafe Mortaza(c), Abu Hider, Al-Amin Hossain, Taskin Ahmed
India: Rohit Sharma, Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, Yuvraj Singh, MS Dhoni(w/c), Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Ashish Nehra, Jasprit Bumrah
India going in with the same team that played against Sri Lanka. Bangladesh have included Nasir Hossain and Abu Haider Rony.
India won the toss and have opted to bowl in reduced 15 overs game.
Both captains now walking out for the toss.
The game has been reduced to 15-overs a side. Fielding restrictions for five overs, and a bowler can bowl a maximum of three overs. Match starts at 21:00 IST.
Umpires are out in the middle for the inspection. Indian skipper MS Dhoni walks up to the umpires for a quick word.

The ground is getting prepared, super-soppers are out. Players are warming up alongside. #BANvIND #AsiaCupT20 pic.twitter.com/ehtdi5Yv0c

— Bangladesh Cricket (@BCBtigers) March 6, 2016

Can't get a full game now. 14-15 over game at best

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 6, 2016
Seems like a miracle, the ground is all ready with stumps at both ends. Pitch inspection at 20:45 local time, which means we will be losing overs.

Latest from #Mirpur Things have finally started to look good... #AsiaCupT20Final #BanvInd pic.twitter.com/DqOthbOdXr

— Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) March 6, 2016
Covers are steadily being taken off, some Indian players are seen playing football. Now, all eyes on the pitch inspection at 8:00.

The groundsmen are doing all the hard work. It has stopped raining #AsiaCupT20Finalhttps://t.co/zCLP7hQJ36

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 6, 2016
The groundstaff doing a commendable job and so also the drainage ahead of an inspection at 8.
Rain update: It has stopped raining and time for the groundstaff to get into action.

Ground staff out in full strength. Crowds cheering every move. The drainage is amazingly good.....

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 6, 2016
The four floodlights are functional now, but the rain is still steady. Frustrating!
The good news is that three floodlights are back, but  steady drizzle is still on.

Three floodlight towers are now functional at the moment. The covers are still on #AsiaCupFinal pic.twitter.com/yKfs6g7YHh

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 6, 2016
Overs gets reduced if the match doesn't start by 8:30BST and there is possibility of 5-overs-a-side match till 10:40.
Rain update: Still drizzling and obviously the toss has been delayed.
Going by the latest images coming in from Shere Bangla, massive puddles have formed on the outfield, only one floodlight functional now.

Lights back on but water water everywhere... #Mirpur #AsiaCupFinal pic.twitter.com/suuI4dJSqK

— Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) March 6, 2016
The floodlights are back in Shere Bangla but still raining heavily. The ground has taken lot of water, trust the ground drainage guys.

We have lights at Mirpur, might have been better to keep them off????? pic.twitter.com/Ea7NGZVXKk

— Matthew Hayden AM (@HaydosTweets) March 6, 2016
Let's hope the weather clears up soon and allow at least a shortened game. The good thing is that Mirpur ground got a good drainage system. Fingers crossed guys.

Heavy rain at Shere Bangla Stadium. The floodlights are off at the moment #AsiaCupFinalhttps://t.co/rjHSECiwvT

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 6, 2016
Check out VVS Laxman's Tweet. This is how the ground looks like from the press box

Sight at the stadium in Mirpur.Totally blacked out,no power What's happening! !! @BCCI #AsiaCupT20 pic.twitter.com/Yxh3bnnthA

— VVS Laxman (@VVSLaxman281) March 6, 2016
Lights go out at the Shere Bangla National Stadium..

Lights gone. Stadium in complete darkness.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 6, 2016

Premature!! Huge dust storm, things flying all over, pitch report crew charging back, lights going off........

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 6, 2016
"That changed quickly," Harsha Bhogle quotes Russel Arnold
This is scary. Rain has come back in Mirpur. The covers are on. Seems there is a huge dust storm. The lights are going off

#AsiaCupT20Final : Rain again in Mirpur, covers have come on pic.twitter.com/SDG48Sdjo8

— ANI (@ANI_news) March 6, 2016

Cloudy. Odd droplet. Covers came on. But precautionary. Off already.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 6, 2016
Harsha Bhogle tweets from Dhaka, says covers are being removed from the pitch. Good news this!
More covers being brought on to the ground with a steady drizzle on, but doesn't look threatening. Not to forget, there is no reserve day in case of washout and the trophy gets shared.
Not the piece of news one would have liked to be coming in from Dhaka. Light drizzle and the pitches covered.

Expecting a keen tussle between a dominating Ind side & an improved Bang team.Can Bang handle the pressure of a final?? @BCCI #AsiaCupT20

— VVS Laxman (@VVSLaxman281) March 6, 2016

#TeamIndia leaves for the stadium. Match starts in 2 hrs #AsiaCupFinal #IndvBanhttps://t.co/7Dw3ZoC9za

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 6, 2016
