India have remained unbeaten in this tournament but Bangladesh always known to pack a punch over their weight can surprise the visitors. India will be eyeing their sixth Asia Cup title and Bangladesh their first.
Hello and welcome to the LIVE coverage as the Asia Cup is all set for a thrilling finish with India taking on an unpredictable Bangladesh side in final.

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: After Shikhar Dhawan's well-crafted 60, Virat Kohli stayed till the end to take India over the finish line chasing Bangladesh's target of 121.

metatags.pagetitle: MS Dhoni's quickfire nails Bangladesh in Asia Cup final
metatags.metadescription: After Shikhar Dhawan's well-crafted 60, Virat Kohli stayed till the end to take India over the finish line chasing Bangladesh's target of 121.
metatags.keywords: Asia Cup T20 final,India vs Bangladesh,Live S

cricket_live_blog.display_title_landing_page: Asia Cup T20: Yuvraj Singh shows glimpses of his vintage self as India crush UAE by 9 wickets)
cricket_live_blog.title: Asia Cup T20: Yuvraj Singh shows glimpses of his vintage self as India crush UAE by 9 wickets

details.content_title: That's all we have today. Join us for the final on Sunday

We need 15 mins to learn bad habit. You need maybe 5-10 games to develop a good habit. It is very important for the guys who played today to keep pushing the selectors and the skipper. The batting order, only Rahane was left out. More often this is our batting order. We felt it was important to give games to bowlers who have not played so far. There is always scope for improvement. We will have to be consistent in big games. I can only promote a few players at a time. Everybody has got enough chances to bat. We will have to come in with another big performance in the final. Bangladesh are a good team and they have improved a lot. It should be a good final: Dhoni
MS Dhoni wants his men to come up with another big performance in the final against Bangladesh

Wickets here have been challenging. Glad that were able to put up a performance like that. You have see of the conditions and get a hang of the conditions before playing your shots. On a wicket like this, you need to give yourself some time and I did exactly that tonight. Important to select your shots - when there's extra bounce, you play a little bit squarer. That's what our batsmen have been doing and we have been discussing that as well: Rohit
It was a good knock from the in-form Rohit. He was unfortunate to get out on 39
Rohit Sharma is the Man of the Match
10.1 overs: Yuvraj does an MSD there. Hits a boundary to finish the match. India have routed UAE here. IND 82/1
10 overs: India are a hit away from victory with 10 overs to go. IND 78/1
9.5 overs: Yuvraj comes down the track and was almost beaten. He gets an edge and collects a boundary. IND 77/1
8.4 overs: SIX! Yuvraj deposits one into the long-off boundary. It was a free flowing Yuvraj there. Is he back? IND 72/1
8 overs: Dhawan and Yuvraj are in a hurry. India need 20 runs from 12 overs. It has been a dominating effort from the Men in Blue
That looked like vintage Yuvraj. He hasn't taken time to get going here. The innings against Sri Lanka should have helped him.
7.1 overs: Four! Lovely shot! Yuvraj Singh guides the ball through the cover. IND 51/1
6.6 overs: Four! Dhawan finally gets off the middle. Nicely driven off the back foot. IND 47/1
Yuvraj Singh walks in at No 3. Finally MS Dhoni promotes him

5.5 overs: WICKET! End of a good knock from Rohit Sharma. He hits one straight into the hands of the third man. Rohit would have wanted that one to fly out of the park. Unfortunately it hasn't. IND 43/1
4.2 overs: Rohit at it again. Pulls one to the mid-wicket boundary. It's lovely to watch when this man is on song. IND 29/0
4 overs: Rohit scored 16 runs off the last over. He hit a six and two well-timed boundaries. IND 24/0
3.4 overs: SIX! Rohit Sharma opens up.  He smokes one into the stands. Javed in a bit of pressure after conceding a boundary of the previous ball
2.3 overs: Naveed beats Dhawan. The UAE team is appealing. No reaction from the umpire. The replays confirm a nick. Unlucky Naveed. IND 8/0
2 overs: Amjad Javed bowls another tight over. 2 runs off it. A slow start from India. IND 7/0
1 overs: Good first over from Mohammad Naveed. He bowled a consistent line to keep Rohit Shamra quiet. IND 5/0
Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan are in the middle

It was a good evening for India with the ball. Bhuvneshwar Kumar looked better today as he was able to swing the ball both ways. 42 percent of his deliveries were outswingers, 16 were inswingers and 24 percent were straight ones. Shows Bhuvneshwar has reverted to swing bowling. Good for Team India.

74 dot balls were bowled by India today. Shows UAE's approach. Bhuvneshwar Kumar alone bowled 20 dots. No UAE batsman except Shaiman Anwar showed application. It was nothing effort with the bat from UAE
20 overs: A dot ball to end the innings. Bhuvneshwar finishes with 4-2-1-8. Disappointing effort from UAE (81/9 in 20 overs)
19. 5 overs: WICKET! Shaiman wanted the strike badly but Dhoni was quick with the gloves to effect a run out. The UAE batsman walks off after scoring 42 from 48. UAE 81/9
19.2 overs: WICKET! Bhuvneshwar Kumar gets his second wicket. Naveed out for 5. It has been a good effort from the comeback man in this match. UAE 80/8
18.4 overs: Just when we said that, Shaiman flat-bats one straight behind Bumrah's head. First six off the innings. He moves to 42. UAE 80/7
Despite this being a dead-rubber, its disheartening to see the lack of effort from the UAE batsmen. It looks like they have given up hope. Its painful for the viewers
Dhoni has been enjoying his time out there. He has been vocal and animated behind the stumps today
17.2 overs: Dhoni is appealing for a run out. He was lightning quick in an effort to remove Naveed who was walking back to the crease. Not Out is the signal on the big screen.
16.6 overs: WICKET! UAE have wasted a wicket here. Pawan Negi runs Farhad Tariq out. There was no chance of a run. UAE 66/7
15.5 overs: WICKET! Stunning catch from Hardik Pandya in the deep. Yuvraj Singh opens his account. UAE slump to 63/6 after losing Kaleem for 2
13.2 overs: WICKET! Harbhajan joins the party as he removes Amjad Javed. UAE 53/5
12.5 overs: WICKET! Negi strikes in his first over on debut, gets rid of Muhammad Usman. UAE in deep trouble, 51/4
8 overs: Bhajji starts with a maiden. UAE 25/2
7.1 overs: Hrabhajan Singh in the attack and he's right on the money here.
7 overs: Good first over from Pandya. Four off it as UAE reach 25/2
6.1 overs: Hardik Pandya in the attack - he has been very impressive in this tournament so far
6 overs: UAE reach 21/2 at the end of the batting power-play
5 overs: UAE 14/. They really are struggling here against India
4.2 overs: DROPPED! It was a tough chance for Raina at slips and the ball races away for FOUR! FIrst runs off Bhuvi as Mustafa gets lucky
4 overs; UAE 7/2 with Shaiman Anwar and Rohan Mustafa in the middle
3.3 overs: WICKET! Easy for Bumrah as he knocks over Mohammad Shahzad for a duck. UAE 2/2 in the fourth over
3 overs: Another maiden for Bhuvi. UAE 1/1 off 3 overs
2.4 overs: WICKET! Patil closes the face of the bat and easy catch for Bhuvi, who has struck in his second over on comeback
2.2 overs: Bhuvi is getting serious swing here.
2 overs: Just one run off that over. India are tightening the noose already
1.5 overs: Patil slashes at that one but good work by Bumrah near the ropes. Just a single
1.3 overs: Full toss from Bumrah but Swapnil Patil fails to get it away
1.1 overs: Jasrpit Bumrah in the attack - he has been in terrific form since his debut earlier this year
1 over: Bhuvi starts with a maiden. This Indian pace-attack will create plenty of problems for UAE
0.3 over: Three dot balls on-the-trot from Bhuvi
0.1 over: Rohan Mustafa on strike. Bhuvaneshwar Kumar gets some swing straightaway
A minute's silence observed for Martin Crowe.

Slip catching drills courtesy @ashwinravi99 #AsiaCup #IndvsUAE pic.twitter.com/VYmf4n1J5t

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 3, 2016

Teams:India: Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, Yuvraj Singh, MS Dhoni(w/c), Hardik Pandya, Pawan Negi, Harbhajan Singh, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Jasprit BumrahUAE: Rohan Mustafa, Muhammad Kaleem, Mohammad Shahzad, Shaiman Anwar, Muhammad Usman, Amjad Javed(c), Swapnil Patil(w), Mohammad Naveed, Qadeer Ahmed, Fahad Tariq, Ahmed Raza
Three changes for India, Pawan Negi makes his debut, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Harbhajan Singh make comebacks.
UAE won the toss and have opted to bat.
Both captains walking out for the toss.

Just a little pitch inspection by captain @msdhoni before the toss #AsiaCup #IndvsUAE pic.twitter.com/NKYGE6Udn1

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 3, 2016
The toss coming up in 15 minutes, but BCCI have confirmed Pawan Negi making his debut in this match. Good luck young man!

Big day for @iampawannegi. He is all set to make his T20I debut for India against UAE #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/pzdtNXxb2P

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 3, 2016

UAE having topped in the qualifying have failed miserably to put up any impression in the main stage, however, they will be seeking redemption in this outing. The toss in 30 minutes time, so guys stay tuned.

Hello and welcome to the live coverage from Match 9 of the Asia Cup between India and UAE in Dhaka. Despite being a dead rubber, this match holds lot of importance for India if at all they decide to test their bench strength. Players like Pawan Negi and Harbhajan Singh might get a look in.

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: India made light work of UAE on Thursday to win their fourth consecutive match in this year's Asia Cup. Led by the comeback man Bhuvneshwar Kumar, India thrashed a sorry UAE by 9 wickets. (Live Scorecard )

metatags.pagetitle: Asia Cup T20: Yuvraj Singh shows glimpses of his vintage self as India crush UAE by 9 wickets
metatags.metadescription: India having made to the final will take this match against UAE as a practice one and in all probability test their bench strength.
metatags.keywords: India vs UAE,Asia Cup T20,Live Score

cricket_live_blog.display_title_landing_page: Yuvraj Singh turns the heat on in Mirpur after bowlers shine)
cricket_live_blog.title: Yuvraj Singh turns the heat on in Mirpur after bowlers shine

details.content_title:
.@imVkohli is the Man of the Match as #TeamIndia march into the final of #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/kkumg0uAMg

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 1, 2016
Virat Kohli gets the Man of the Match award.
This was 8th win for India in their last 9 T20Is as they build-up well for the World T20.

McCullum (70) & Gayle (43) have 13 T20I half centuries...Kohli has got to that mark in 34 innings. Averages 80 in successful chases. ??????????

— Aakash Chopra (@cricketaakash) March 1, 2016

Comprehensive win for Ind??Good bowling effort & a special knock by @imVkohli but I was very happy 2 c the way @YUVSTRONG12 played???? @BCCI

— VVS Laxman (@VVSLaxman281) March 1, 2016
19.2 overs: Virat Kohli seals the match with a boundary to midwicket as India beat Sri Lanka by 5 wickets to seal a berth in Asia Cup final. Kohli remained unbeaten on 56.
18.5 overs: Virat Kohli gets to his fifty in style, his 13th in T20Is.
17.5 overs: Out. Pandya gets castled trying to play against the line to Herath. The ball pitching on off and turning enough to knock back the off stump. Kohli at the other end not very happy.
Hardik Pandya is the new man in.
16.5 overs: Out. Yuvraj goes for the hook off Perera but straight down the throat of the fine leg fielder. But a great cameo from the left-handed batsman - 35 of 18 balls.
Looks like the umpires have asked for the ball to be changed. India now need 23 off 23 balls.
15.6 overs: Yuvraj has raced to 31 off 16 balls with Kohli taking a back seat at the other end and happy playing the second fiddle. India 112 for 3.
14.3 overs: Six. Yuvraj makes room and hits it over deep backward point.
13.6 overs: Chameera manages to beat Yuvraj on couple of occasions, just four runs from his over. India 96 for 3 .
12.6 overs: Finally we get to see the vintage Yuvraj Singh, as he takes Herath to the cleaners with two successive sixes. Kohli batting on 33 with India 92 for 3 in 13 overs.
Yuvraj Singh is the new batsman at the crease.
11.1 overs: Out. Dasun Shanaka gets the breakthrough by snaring out Raina for 25 caught by Kulasekara at mid-off. The ball looked like stopping on and Raina going with the shot.
10.6 overs: Rangana Herath does well in his first over, gives only four runs. India 70 for 2.
9.6 overs: Kohli and Raina have now brought up their fifty-run stand as India look comfortably placed in the chase of 139. India 66 for 2.
9.5 overs: Four. Not that bad a ball but Raina tucks it to the midwicket fence. Great shot!
8.6 overs: The unbeaten 42-run partnership between Kohli and Raina has steered India well after early setbacks. Suddenly, the pitch seem to have no demons in it. India 58 for 2.
6.6 overs: Kohli and Raina have stitched together a 26-run partnership, but on this track both batsmen can't take anything for granted. India 42 for 2.

4.6 overs: Just five runs from Mathews over and looks like the Indians won't find the chase so easy. Suresh Raina and Virat Kohli need a partnership going on as India can't afford to lose wickets from here on.
3.6 overs: Four. On the pads and Suresh Raina flicks it well to the midwicket fence. India 20 for 2.
3.2 overs: Out. Kulasekara strikes again and this time gets the big wicket of Rohit Sharma for 15 caught in the slips. Lazy drive from the batsman, gets a thick edge to Kapugedera standing at slip.
1.6 overs: Out. Kulasekara snares out Dhawan cheaply for 1 caught behind. The angle taking the ball away as Dhawan goes after it and gets the edge.
Nuwan Kulasekara into the attack.
0.6 overs: Six runs from the Angelo Mathews' first over. Dhawan and Rohit are out in the middle to start India's chase of 139.

19.6 overs: After a stuttering start to their innings, Sri Lanka have done well to put up a competitive total of 138 for 9 on the board. Sri Lanka were propelled to a decent total after some good contributions down the order. Chase might get tricky for India.
Nuwan Kulasekara has scored two back-to-back fours in the last over.

18.5 overs: Out. Perera steps out again but Ashwin fires it wide and Dhoni behind the stumps completes the stumping. But hold on, replays showing that the batsman was well in by grounding his bat on time. The square leg umpire to blame.
18.2 overs: Six. Perera makes room and pulls Ashwin over the midwicket fence. Clean hitting.
17.6 overs: Thisara Perera straight uses the long handle as he hits Bumrah for two successive boundaries. SL 115 for 7.
17.2 overs: Out. Hardik Pandya takes a brilliant catch off Bumrah's bowling at sweeper cover to send back Kapugedera for 30.
16.6 overs: Out. Can you believe a batsman getting run out on a free hit delivery. Dasun Shanaka was the batsman.
16.1 overs: Out. Ashwin snaps the steady stand by dismissing Siriwardana for 22. SL are now 5 down.
14.4 overs: Four. Rank short from Ashwin and Kapugedera pummels it to the cover boundary.
13.6 overs: Another good over comes Sri Lanka's way, 9 off it. SL 84 for 4.
13.2 overs: MS Dhoni gets on Suresh Raina into the attack and Kapugedera swings it over the short fine leg fielder. Sri Lanka have started playing positive and attacking cricket.
12.6 overs: Jadeja goes for runs in this over, 13 off it. Siriwardana doing the damage with a six and four. SL 75 for 4.
12.2 overs: Six. Siriwardana done playing the waiting game as he decides to attack and launches Jadeja straight down the ground.
10.6 overs: Out. Pandya gets his revenge, castles Mathews for 18 - inside edge on to the stumps. SL 57 for 4 in 11 overs.
10.5 overs: Four. Again short from Pandya and Mathews pulls it to midwicket.
10.1 overs: Four. Short from Pandya and Mathews pulls it well. With that boundary, Sri Lanka get to 50
Four. Angelo Mathews makes room and hits Jadeja straight down the ground.
Ravindra Jadeja introduced into the attack and gets turn immediately.
8.6 overs: Angelo Mathews also not looking at his best out in the middle. Just six runs from Pandya's last over. SL 41 for 3.

Another top opening spell from Nehra and Bumrah gives Dhoni the control a captain relishes.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 1, 2016
Bowling change from both ends. Yuvraj Singh into the attack.

6.1 overs: Out. Hardik Pandya strikes first ball of his over and gets the big fish, Tillakaratne Dilshan for 18 caught by Ashwin. Dilshan never looked comfortable at the middle. SL 31 for 3 in 6.1 overs.

Ashish Nehra continues his wicket taking form with the new ball. @IPL @SunRisers #SRH

— Tom Moody (@TomMoodyCricket) March 1, 2016
No bowling change yet as Bumrah continues.

4.6 overs: Nehra gets through his three overs and in the fifth delivery he had Chamara Kapugedera trapped lbw with replays showing the ball hitting the stumps, but the umpire didn't think so. SL 22 for 2.
3.6 overs: Outstanding over from Bumrah, six runs and one wicket. Sri Lanka are 15 for 2.

3.4 overs: Out. Bumrah strikes this time to get rid of Shehan Jayasuriya caught behind for 3. Mild appeals from the wicketkeeper and the bowler but the umpire was convinced of an edge. Sri Lanka lose their second.
2.6 overs: Four runs from the over and a wicket. After the end of three overs it looks like batting ain't that easy out there. SL 9 for 1.
Nehra still getting the ball to shape in to the right-handed batsman Tillakaratne Dilshan. Shehan Jayasuriya is the new batsman at the crease.
2.2 overs: Out. Nehra strikes early, dismisses Dinesh Chandimal for 4 caught behind.
1.6 overs: Top over from Bumrah, gives only one run. The youngster varied his length quite well. SL 5 for 0.
Jasprit Bumrah into the attack.
0.6 overs: Decent start from Nehra, concedes just four runs in the over. Hint of swing off the deck first up for Nehra. SL 4 for 0.
0.2 overs: Length ball from Nehra and Chandimal pierces it through the cover field. Top shot!
0.1 overs: Nehra starts with a big inswinger to Chandimal and the batsman does well.
All set for the start with Indian fielders and Lankan openers making their way to the middle. Ashish Nehra to start the proceedings for India.

The big thumbs up before the game from @ImRo45 #INDvSL #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/sQbC74l54X

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 1, 2016
Dean Jones in his pitch report reckoned that the pitch looks good for a T20 game. The pitch got little of grass with few cracks to go as well.

Teams    India: Shikhar Dhawan, Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, Yuvraj Singh, MS Dhoni(w/c), Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Jasprit Bumrah, Ashish NehraSri Lanka: Dinesh Chandimal(w), Tillakaratne Dilshan, Shehan Jayasuriya, Angelo Mathews(c), Milinda Siriwardana, Chamara Kapugedera, Thisara Perera, Dasun Shanaka, Nuwan Kulasekara, Dushmantha Chameera, Rangana Herath
One change for India, Shikhar Dhawan replaces Ajinkya Rahane. Sri Lanka on the other hand are unchanged.
India won the toss and have opted to bowl.

What tips you reckon is @HaydosTweets giving to @YUVSTRONG12 #IndvSL #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/tg5hLwTVDM

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 1, 2016
Guys, we are less than 30 minutes away from the toss. Are Dhawan, Rohit fit for the game? We will find that out soon.

.@ImRo45 is warming up with some knocking ahead of #IndvSL #AsiaCuphttps://t.co/4ac57eUf6a

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 1, 2016

Sri Lanka having lost their last match to Bangladesh find themselves in a must-win situation to stay alive in the race. However, with two back-to-back wins, India are sitting pretty and are one win away from booking the final berth.

Both teams have injury problems to take care of before the match. For India, Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit Sharma are doubtful and Sri Lanka might miss out on the services from their skipper Lasith Malinga.
Hello and welcome to the live coverage from the Match 7 of the Asia Cup between India and Sri Lanka in Mirpur. If India beat Sri Lanka they are through to the final.

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: Riding on Virat Kohli's unbeaten 56, India successfully chased down Sri Lanka's target of 139 to win the match by 5 wickets. Scorecard

highlights.highlight:
• Virat Kohli scores his 13th T20I half-century, fastest to achieve the milestone from 34 innings
  • Bumrah, Pandya, Ashwin finished with two wickets
  • Yuvraj Singh scored a breezy 18-ball 35
  • This was India's 8th win in their last 9 T20Is

metatags.pagetitle: Yuvraj Singh turns the heat on in Mirpur after bowlers shine
metatags.metadescription: Riding on Virat Kohli's unbeaten 56, India successfully chased down Sri Lanka's target of 139 to win the match by 5 wickets.
metatags.keywords: India vs Sri Lanka,Asia Cup T20,Live score

cricket_live_blog.display_title_landing_page: Here's how Virat Kohli overcame a fiery Mohammad Amir in tense chase)
cricket_live_blog.title: Here's how Virat Kohli overcame a fiery Mohammad Amir in tense chase

details.content_title: Initially we thought this would be good practice for the T20 World Cup, but the conditions here are very different. I think it's good for us. We are one team, who like to play aggressive cricket and I think the conditions here will push us. I thought Amir bowled really well for them. I am glad that we restricted them to 83 : MS Dhoni

.@imVkohli delights the fans after his match-winning knock #IndvPak #AsiaCuphttps://t.co/Ar2LLraaBK

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 27, 2016
I would like to congratulate Mohammad Amir for the way he bowled, I actually congratulated him while he was bowling. It was amazing to play such a spell: Virat Kohli

Kohli: It wasn't an easy wicket to bat, I wasn't happy with myself in the last game, where I went too hard at the ball, I had to respect the conditions, I made mistakes in the last innings but I dug in this time.
Virat Kohli is the Man of the Match for his outstanding knock of 49

Yuvraj Singh: It was tough, the Pakistan bowlers bowled quick, not easy to bat, Virat batted outstandingly and we bowled really well. It was a situation where you had to fight it out and I was happy to spend some time out there. Hopefully next game I will hit the ball better. I stuck out there and did not give my wicket away.
15.3 overs: MS Dhoni hits the winning runs in his own style. India have thrashed Pakistan to make it 5-1 in T20Is. IND 85/5
15.2 overs: Yuvraj taps that and jogs for a single. Three more runs for victory
15.1 overs: Wahab into his last over. Dot-ball.
15 overs: India need four off five overs to win this one! Pakistan need five wickets
14.5 overs: Dhoni gets that through the gap and runs three even though he did not seem to sprint the way he does
MS Dhoni in the middle for India. Yuvraj at the other end. The same pair which took India past the line in the World Cup final of 2011
14.3 overs: WICKET! Sami gets another one, removes Pandya for a duck. Is there a twist in the tale yet? India still need eight runs with five wickets in hand

14.1 overs: WICKET! Loud appeal by Sami against Kohli and the umpire raises his finger - gone for 49! That was a terrible decision by the umpire, who adjudged lbw. There was a definite edge. Kohli walks off with a smile
14 overs: India need eight off six overs. Kohli needs one run for his 13th fifty
13.5 overs: Kohli takes a single, moves to 49. Yuvraj on strike for the last ball of the over
13.2 overs: Kohli takes a single off Wahab, moves to 44 and hands strike to Yuvraj, who has batted beautifully. He has curtailed his natural style to just hang in there for Kohli and India
13 overs: Kohli takes a single to take India to 69/3. They need  15 more off seven overs
12.5 over: Yuvraj heaves that in the air and it's only a sigle
12.5 overs: No-ball and Free-Hit to Yuvraj as Kohli ran a single
12.4 overs: Pakistan fielders are all hovering inside the circle to cut the singles out. The pacers have been brilliant but Kohli has been just way too good
12.4 overs: Kohli nudges it away on the on-side and called for two straightaway! Easy at the end
12.1 overs: Mohammad Irfan back for his last over. His figures: 3-0-10-0
12 overs: Five off that Sami over as India reach 63/3, needing another 21 off 48 balls to beat Pakistan
11.3 ovrs: FOUR! Sweet, sweet shot off the pads. Sami errs slightly and Kohli punishes him.
11 overs: Kohli takes a single to keep strike. 50-run partnership between Kohli and Yuvraj. India 58/3
10.5 overs: Yuvraj takes a single to get Kohli on strike
10.4 overs: Wide down the leg-side. Pakistan's body language has suddenly deteriorated
10.3 overs: Wahab has come back well. He hasn't allowed Yuvraj to get away so far yet this over.
10.1 overs: Yuvraj drives the fullish ball and it goes straight to the fielder. Dot-ball! Wahab gets away with it
10.1 overs: Wahab continues and no-ball!!!! FREE-HIT for India.
10 overs: India 54/3, half-way into the innings. They need 30 more to win
9.4 overs: India are still being a little watchful against Sami. He did bowl an excellent first over with the new ball and there's no real need to do anything silly after that 15-run over off Wahab
9.1 overs: Sami back in the attack and Kohli gets an inside-edge but they run too.
9 overs: India 50/3, chasing 84
8.5 overs: FOUR! Hello YUVRAJ SINGH! That was sweetly timed off the pads. 15 runs off the over so far.
8.3 overs: FOUR! Wahab overpitches and Kohli helps himself to a few more runs. He's steering India on his own
8.2 overs: Kohli takes two more. He has looked excellent so far.
8.1 overs: FOUR! Take that Wahab! Kohli welcomes Pakistan's best bowler with a splendid shot through square of the wicket on the off-side.
8.1 overs: Bowling change! Wahab Riaz in the attack. Phew, the Pakistanis just keep coming
8 overs: Six off the over as India reach 35/3, chasing 84
7.5 overs: FOUR! That was an edge and landed just short of the fielder in the slip-cordon. But India won't mind that. India 34/3
7.4 overs: Irfan is extracting extra bounce. Only one run off the over so far.
7.2 overs: Irfan may not have picked a wicket yet but he has been been mighty effective. He's in his third over and given away only six runs so far
7 overs: Amir is done and India will breathe a sigh of relief. They are 29/3, chasing 84 vs Pakistan
6.5 overs: That one kept low. Kohli does well to defend it.
6.3 overs: FOUR! Cracking! Dazzling! Slow clap! Beautifully driven through covers. Kohli, take a bow!
6.1 overs: Amir is going to bowl out here. He has taken 3/10 so far
6 overs: India 21/3 after the end of the batting Powerlay
5.4 overs: Yuvraj Singh is watching the ball really well here. Irfan is bowling beautifully and Yuvi has seen the ball right through till the last moment
5.3 overs: So far so good from Irfan too. Only one run off the over so far.
5 overs: India 20/3, chasing 84. They do not need to take too many risks here tonight. Only 64 needed off 15 overs for victory
4.3 overs: OOOOOOH!! That throw from Umar Akmal caught the umpire in a very sensitive spot. The Pakistan players are quick to apologise while Umar looks away . A small break

With 4 fast bowlers, Pakistan will play this like a 16 over game.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) February 27, 2016
4.1 overs: That's an outside edge but it went through the gap. India 19/3
4.1 overs: FOUR! Too high and wide called. Five added to the total as India reach 18/3
4 overs: India 13/3. A target of 84 is looking 200 now
3.3 overs: Irfan is getting good bounce on this surface. India have an uphill task here.
3.1 overs: FOUR! Irfan in the attack and sublime timing by Yuvraj - the ball blazes away through covers
3 overs: India 9/3, chasing 84. Yuvraj Singh in the middle with Kohli
2.4 overs: WICKET! That was too quick for Raina as chips it up in the air. He is gone for 1. Pakistan 8/3 off 2/4 overs
2.3 overs: Loud, loud appeal against Kohli for an lbw. But the umpire is unmoved.
2.2 overs: Amir is right on the money. Kohli is looking solid at the other end. This will be a cracking contest
2.1 overs: Raina somehow gets a bat to the a pacey Amir delivery and that's good running. A single and Kohli is back on strike
2 overs: Kohli is not going to panic. he plays out another dot-ball. India 6/2
1.5 over: Two more runs to the total..
1.4 overs: Beautifully defended by Kohli. He knows India don't have to bother about the scoring-rate. They need only 84 to chase
1.3 overs: Kohli clips that one to the leg-side and picks up two. His technique looks solid against a quality pace attack on a green pitch
1.2 overs: Sami delivers two successive dot-balls. Kohli will be the key to this chase.
1.1 overs: Mohammad Sami to Virat Kohli. Calmly played away to the off-side. Dot-ball.
1 over: India 2/2.. What a sensational start from Mohammad Amir
0.5 over: Raina the new man in and whoa, that was another peach from Amir. Raina survives somehow
0.4 over: WICKET! Amir is on fire. He has removed Rahane for a duck. Another lbw appeal upheld by the umpire. India 2/2 chasing 84
0.3 over: Wide down the leg-side. This is a golden opportunity for Rahane, who has replaced Dhawan
0.3 over: Virat Kohli walks in and gets off the mark with a single
02 over: WICKET! Mohammad Amir has removed the in-form Rohit Sharma for a duck in the second ball of the innings. India 0/1 chasing 84
Bumrah had bowed 16 dots in three overs. This shows how disciplined this young bowler can be. Brilliant stuff!

Pakistan bowled out for 83 here. It's their lowest T20I score against India. New-ball bowlers Nehra and Bumrah were spot on. Ravindra Jadeja was electric on the field and he picked up two wickets as well. Hardik Pandya did his job with the ball. What a valuable player he is proving out to be. PAK 83/10 in 17.3 overs.
It was my first India-Pakistan game. It was really exciting but I tried to treat it as a normal game: Jasprit Bumrah

How disappointed and angry would Inzamam be? Tune into @aajtak now to listen his narrative of Pak collapse #IndvsPak #SuperhitMuqabla

— Vikrant Gupta (@vikrantgupta73) February 27, 2016
17.2 overs: WICKET! Take that. Excellent delivery from Pandya and horrible shot by Sami. Pakistan are 83/9 and in serious threat of being bowled out under 100
17 overs: With three overs left, Pakistan are 83/8. Will they cross 100?
16.2 overs: Five wides. Useful runs for Pakistan. The tail will look to take Pakistan past 100 now
16.1 overs: FOUR! Sami hammers that one to the fence. Ashwin has not erred very often but that was a poor delivery
16 overs: Four overs left and Pakistan are 71/8 vs India. Amir and Sami in the midde
15.2 overs: Mohammad Amir in the middle. Spare a thought for him. He is under pressure to see Pakistan through the next four overs
15.1 overs: WICKET! Jadeja strikes to remove Sarfraz (25). Pakistan 70/8 after he missed a straight ball.
14 overs: Good over by Jadeja.. Just five runs off it. Pakistan 63/7
13 overs: Two runs only off Ashiwn's first over.

Am sorry, but Pakistanj fans will be furious: Their team didn't turn up today. Can see the soda-bottle affect #IndvsPak #SuperhitMuqabla

— Vikrant Gupta (@vikrantgupta73) February 27, 2016
12.1 overs: R Ashwin in the attack. Spin from both sides now
12 overs: Five runs off the over and a wicket for Jadeja. Pakistan 56/7
11.4 overs: WICKET! Jadeja strikes, removes Wahab Riaz for 4. Pakistan are crumbling here. PAK 52/7.
11 overs: Four runs off the over and Pakistan are 51/6 vs India
10.4 overs: Three singles off the over so far. It's a tough call for Sarfraz - when does he start accelerating?
10.1 overs: Pandya to continue with his third over. Wahab takes a single off a length ball.
10 overs: Pakistan are 47/6; another excellent over from Yuvraj Singh. R Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja haven't even bowled yet
9.4 overs: Pakistan's running between the wickets has been abysmal so far.
9.1 overs: Yuvraj backs for his second over and delivers a full-toss but Sarfraz gets only a single. That gets Wahab on strike
9 overs: Pakistan are 43/6, just one run off the over. This has been a complete embarrassment for Pakistan so far
8.5 overs: Pandya tests Wahab with a well-directed bouncer
8.4 overs: Sarfraz hands stroke to Wahab Riaz. What can he do here but provide solid support to the last recognized batsman
8.3 overs: This is turning out to be another great spell by Pandya.

Jadeja isn't just the quickest Indian on the field ever but also the possessor of the finest throwing arm.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) https://twitter.com/bhogleharsha/status/703583578488119296">February 27, 2016
8 overs: DISASTER! Pakistan have lost Shahid Afridi, run-out affected by Ravindra Jadeja. Pakistan are 42/6 vs India
7.3 overs: FOUR! Nicely placed by Sarfraz. A little quick and wide from Yuvraj. Pakistan 40/5
7.1 overs: WICKET! Yuvraj Singh in the attack and he strikes off the first ball. Umar Akmal has been trapped LBW for three. Disaster for Pakistan; 35/5 as Afridi walks into the middle
7 overs: WICKET! Hardik Pandya has removed Malik and ends his 12-ball painful stay in the middle. He scored only 4. Pakistan are 35/4 after seven overs
6.5 overs: This has been an excellent over by Pandya so far. Three runs off it so far

It's a passionate https://twitter.com/hashtag/IndvPak?src=hash">#IndvPak crowd as India make early breakthroughs. Follow LIVE: https://t.co/IV5TeC1r9P">https://t.co/IV5TeC1r9P> https://twitter.com/hashtag/AsiaCup?src=hash">#AsiaCup https://t.co/NA6LOm89G1">pic.twitter.com/NA6LOm89G1

— ICC (@ICC) https://twitter.com/ICC/status/703577908019916800">February 27, 2016
6.3 overs: Umar Akmal hands strike back to Malik. Two of Pakistan's most experienced batsmen in the middle. Pakistan feeling the heat thanks to India's sensational fielding
6.1 overs: Change in the attack. Hardik Pandya replaces Nehra
6 overs: Do-ball to end the over. Pakistan 32/3 after the Powerplay
5.5 overs: WICKET! That's the end of Khurram Manzoor. Not sure if Malik called for the single and then sent Manzoor back. But he was too far away from the crease as Kohli affected a direct hit
5.4 overs: Good shot by Malik but the ball hits the stumps at the non-striker's end
5.2 overs: Loud appeal for lbw against Malik. Rameez Raja feels the angle would have taken the ball down the leg-side
5.1 overs: FOUR! Legbyes.. Slightly erring in line again and Pakistan are 32/2

So far so good for India. Opting to bowl first was a gamble so 2 wkts in first 5-6 overs will peg Pak back #SuperhitMuqabla #INDvPak

— Vikrant Gupta (@vikrantgupta73) February 27, 2016
4.4 overs: Loud appeal against Manzoor and the umpire stays put. Not out, he says for a caugh-behind appeal. Virat Kohli is not happy at all
4 overs: Excellent delivery to finish the over. Pakistan 26/1
3.5 overs: FOUR! Cracking shot from Malik as Bumrah landed slightly wide.
3.4 overs: Shoaib Malik in the middle and he is greeted with a peach of a delivery from Bumrah
3.3 overs: WICKET! Bumrah has the last laugh here after that spectacular boundary. Sharjeel nicked it to the slip-cordon and the Indian team is ecstatic. Pakistan 22/2
3.2 overs: Good comeback by Bumrah. Dot-ball
3.1 overs: FOUR! That was brutal. Slight error in line from Bumrah and boom! Pakistan 22/1
3 overs: Good over for Pakistan, 13 coming off it. Pakistan 18.1
2.5 overs: Dot-ball from Nehra.
2.3 overs: This is turning out to be a good over for Pakistan - three more runs added to the total
2.2 overs: Great effort by Ravindra Jadeja. Well-timed by Manzoor and the ball ran away to the fence but Jadeja won the race and saved a run for his team
2.1 overs: FOUR! That was bludgeoned by Manzoor. Good, aggressive intent there.
2.1 overs: Nehra bowls a wide down the lef-side to Sharjeel Khan

Hafeez, to my mind, was the most dangerous of the Pakistan batsmen. And a wkt in first over will pep the Indians up #IndvsPak #AsiaCupT20

— Vikrant Gupta (@vikrantgupta73) February 27, 2016
2 overs: Maiden over from Bumrah. Wow. fantastic start from India! Pakistan 5/1
1.4 overs: Ooh, that was close. Had Manzoor missed the ball, he would have been lbw
1.3 overs; Three dot-balls on-the-trot. "He needs to relax," says Rameez Raja on air
1.2 overs: Manzoor is not looking very comfortable. Another dot-ball. The pitch is offering plenty of assistance to the pacers
1.1 overs: Jasprit Bumrah with the new ball. Manzoor on strike
1 over: Manzorr off the mark with a single on the off-side. Pakistan 5/1
0.5 oveer: Khurram Manzoor the new man in. He gets behind the line of the ball and it's another dot
0.4 over: WICKET! Good bounce from Nehra and that's the end of Hafeez. A feather edge and Dhoni takes an easy catch behind the wickets. Pakistan 4/1
0.3 over: Dot-ball from Nehra. Slip and gully in place
0.1 over: Nehra runs in to bowl the first over of the match. Hafeez defends
Pakistan's openers are out in the middle. Indian fielders taking their positions. The crowd is making a LOT of noise at the Sher-e-Bangla Stadium. This will be a CRACKER!!
India have won six out of their last seven T20s this year while Pakistan have won only one of their last six T2os since November 2015. They lost four and tied one.
How well can India cope up without Shikhar Dhawan? Ajinkya Rahane will be hoping to make best use of the opportunity

IND XI: RG Sharma, A Rahane, V Kohli, S Raina, Y Singh, MS Dhoni, H Pandya, R Jadeja, R Ashwin, A Nehra, J Bumrah

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 27, 2016

PAK XI: K Manzoor, S Khan, M Hafeez, S Malik, S Ahmed, U Akmal, S Afridi, Wahab Riaz, M Sami, M Amir, M Irfan

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 27, 2016
India win toss and bowl. Shikhar Dhawan is injured, Ajinkya Rahane gets a game. Pakistan name four fast bowlers on a green top
Indian players are out on the field.  The toss is almost here..

#TeamIndia in a huddle before #IndvPak game #AsiaCuphttps://t.co/vFG0Wo8Bx3

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 27, 2016
Green top in Dhaka! Rohit Sharma and Co. need to watch out

The pitch looks green! It will be a interesting battle of Indian batting vs Pakistani bowling. #IndvPak #AsiaCupT20 pic.twitter.com/1xssSLZL2N

— Bangladesh Cricket (@BCBtigers) February 27, 2016
Inzamam-ul-Haq also tails Ganguly. Senior players need to set the example. Their body language is important for the juniors. However, this is Pakistan's weakest team taking on India: Inzamam

Sourav Ganguly is optimistic about an Indian win tonight. It won't be easy for Pakistan against a quality Indian team. However, The unexpected can happen in T20I cricket, says the former India captain

It's all about handling pressure on the big night. India-Pakistan clashes have always gone to the wires. Talent doesn't matter but handling pressure does, says India Today consulting editor Boria Majumdar
Star Indian batsman Virat Kohli is happy for Mohammad Amir. The comeback man though can prove to be a big threat for the Indian batsmen if there is help from the wicket.
There has been a lot of hype about tonight's game. A lot of former players had chosen their favourite team. Here's what former India captain Kapil Dev has to say about MS Dhoni's men
As we gear up for the big clash, here's is Rajarshi Gupta's preview of the match
Both the teams have left for the stadium

#TeamIndia have left for the stadium for #IndvPak #AsiaCuphttps://t.co/JifqceWSqj

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 27, 2016
We're an hour away from the toss in Dhaka. The big question remains over MS Dhoni's fitness. Will the Indian captain play tonight's game?
How many of you are expecting a cracking Saturday evening?
Hello and Welcome to the LIVE UPDATES of the Asia Cup clash between India and Pakistan.

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: India crushed Pakistan by five wickets after Virat Kohli smashed an unbeaten 49 to help his team cross the finish-line on a green pitch. After being bowled out for 83, Pakistan fought back through Mohammad Amir, who took two wickets in the opening over. But a solid partnership between Kohli and Yuvraj Singh ensured India got home off 15.3 overs.

metatags.pagetitle: Here's how Virat Kohli overcame a fiery Mohammad Amir in tense chase
metatags.metadescription: Arch rivals India and Pakistan will play each other after an year in the Asia Cup clash today. While India are a well-oiled machine at the moment, Pakistan are still looking for the perfect combination. Mahendra Singh Dhoni knows which 11 players will make the final line-up for the ICC World T20 opener against New Zealand on March 15.
metatags.keywords: Ind vs Pak Asia Cup T20,India vs Pakistan,MS

cricket_live_blog.display_title_landing_page: Asia Cup T20: How Hardik Pandya's all-round show turned the tide in India's favour)
cricket_live_blog.title: Asia Cup T20: How Hardik Pandya's all-round show turned the tide in India's favour

details.content_title: India have registered their first win in this year's Asia Cup and they are looking good for more. That's all we have from the opening match.
Here's what the Man of the Match Rohit Sharma and the two captains had to say at the presentation ceremony

Rohit Sharma: It's important for me to start afresh and not look back too much. This is a perfect platform for us before the World Cup. It was unusual to see this kind of wicket in this part of the world. It was always important for one batter to bat as long as possible and I told myself I had to do that.

Mashrafe Mortaza: Last 15 years I've seen that fans always support us. We were in the game till the 14th over but after that Rohit took the game away from us. We bowled a lot of slower ones later and the ball was not gripping.

MS Dhoni: It would've been good to win the toss. We wanted to see the kind of start and then set a target. It was kind of 55-45 with the toss. Rather than hitting the big shots straight down, it was important to cut and use such shots since they were bowling short of length. Batting fearlessly is Hardik's strength and that's why we want to give him more matches, he's a good fielder too and a useful third seamer.

Rohit Sharma claims the MoM for his exciting and match changing innings v Bangladesh #BanvInd #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/SHTi5tNmiC

— ICC (@ICC) February 24, 2016

India have begun their Asia Cup campaign on a high. This has been a formidable performance from the Men in Blue on a green top. Rohit Sharma took the game away from Bangladesh in the middle overs of the first innings. Shakib's drop proved too costly for the home side. This was definitely not a 166-run wicket. Bangladesh bowlers conceded a little too much and their team paid for it. Ashish Nehra and R Ashwin continued their good T20 form to strangulate Bangladesh in the second innings. MS Dhoni would be happy after an all-round show.
20 overs: It's all over in Dhaka. Jadeja bowls one more tidy over to complete proceedings. India have beaten Bangladesh by 45 runs in the Asia Cup opener
19 overs: Six off the last ball from Taskin. That hit comes a little too late. BAN 117/7
18 overs: Jadeja pushes another over in. Six runs scored off it and Bangladesh have given up hope. 60 runs from 12 balls looks too tall!
17 overs: Nehra completes his 4-over quota after scalping three wickets. He has been quite impressive since his return to the Indian side. He is one to watch out for in the coming matches. BAN 102/7
16.5 overs: Taskin Ahmed defends to deny Nehra a hat-trick. Nevertheless the left-hand bowler has done enough damage already
16.4 overs: WICKET! One more for Nehra. Bangladesh skipper Mortaza fails to trouble the scorers. Their chase is falling apart. BAN 100/7
16.3 overs: WICKET! Nehra adds one more to the wicket column. This now looks like a formality. BAN 100/6 after Mahmudullah's exit
16 overs: One more boundary to finish the over. Apart from the odd boundaries scored Bangladesh have struggled to score big in these conditions. India did well to get a score 160 plus score. BAN 96/5
15.4 overs: Four! Mushfiqur Rahim gets a welcome boundary
15 overs: Pandya finishes his spell with one wicket. Bangladesh now need 81 runs from 30 balls. BAN 85/5
14.3 overs: It has started to drizzle in Dhaka. Remember it had rained earlier in the day. Will D/L come into place?
Pandya is proving to be a good fast-bowling allrounder. After a quickfire knock of 31 he has removed Bangladesh's main man
14.1 overs: Big Wicket! Pandya removes the big man Sabbir for 43. It was the end of a fine knock from Sabbir. BAN 84/5
14.1 overs: WICKET!
14 overs: Ashwin finishes with figures of 4-0-1-23.
12.3 overs: WICKET! Huge breakthrough for India. A poor mix-up costs Shakib his wicket. Rohit has enough time to return the ball to Dhoni. BAN 73/4
11.4 overs: SIX! Sabbir hit a huge one over the mid-wicket boundary. However, he is cramping and that's not good news for Bangaldesh. BAN 69/3
Ashwin into his third over
It's time to talk about the asking rate. Bangladesh now need 106 runs from 54 balls. FYI, India scored 114 runs in their last 10 overs.
11 overs: Good stop from Yuvraj Singh at the covers. Pandya completes another tidy over. BAN 61/3
10.3 overs: SIX! And it was the first one of this innings. Sabbir hit one over the mid-wicket fence. BAN 59/3
Shakib's highest score in the last five matches has been a princely 11. This is a big opportunity for the left-hander to get back to business
The No.1 T20 allrounder Shakib Al Hasan walks into the middle.
Mahendra Singh Dhoni gets some attention from the physio. Cramps may be.
Ashwin gets his reward for mixing it up well. He has certainly got quite a lot of variations.
9.5 overs: WICKET! Ashwin snaps steady stand. Imrul Kayes out for 14. BAN 50/3
Ashwin to continue..
Kayes and Sabbir have quietly stitched a run-a-ball 33-run partnership. Can one of them go one and play a big knock?
9 overs: Bangladesh batsman are struggling to score boundaries. It has been difficult after some tight bowling from the Indian bowlers. BAN 48/2
8 overs: Ashwin recovered well after conceding a boundary off the first ball. Six runs off his over. BAN 42/2
Bangladesh just scored their fourth boundary in the eight over. Excellent bowling up-front from the new-ball bowlers Nehra and Bumrah. Dhoni will certainly be happy.
7.1 overs: Sabbir plays a reverse sweep to send a clear message to Ashwin. BAN 40/2
Dhoni's go-to-man Ravichandran Ashwin into the attack
Can Bangladesh come up with a dramatic performance?

If Bangladesh get these from here it will be their most dramatic performance so far in T20 internationals

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) February 24, 2016
6.4 overs: Four singles from the first four balls. Sabbir and Kayes are not taking any risks. One of these two has to do a Rohit for their team. BAN 35/2

A tricky start for Bangladesh who lose 2 early wickets v India - LIVE: https://t.co/Ju4CN1CMI8 #BanvInd #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/EEsrDv7RFN

— ICC (@ICC) February 24, 2016
6.1 overs: First bowling change for India. Hardik Pandya into the attack
6 overs: Another tight over from Bumrah, only 4 runs were scored off it. Bangladesh would have expected a better start. But it has been a difficult track to score runs at will. BAN 31/2
5 overs: Bangaldesh are 27/2 after losing their openers early. Dhoni is continuing with Bumrah here
His partner Imrul Kayes was the second highest run-scorer in Bangladesh Premier League with 312 runs from 12 matches. A crucial combo this for Bangladesh
Sabbir has been amongst the runs in the recent past. He played a couple of blinders against Zimbabwe. He is the key for Bangladesh today
4.1 overs: Cracking shot! Sabbir Rahman dismisses a short-pitched ball to the mid-wicket fence
4 overs: Another successful over for India, 4 runs conceded. Bangladesh are in a spot of bother here. BAN 19/2
Indian new-ball bowlers have removed both the openers early. Nehra and Bumrah are in red-hot form. Both of them have been complementing each other well.
3.2 overs: WICKET! Bumrah gets one here. He hits the deck hard to take the edge off Sarkar's bat. Dhoni takes an easy catch. BAN 15/2
2.3 overs: Nehra is appealing for a inside-edge. The umpire is not impressed. The replays are not showing any nick. Looks like Nehra is hungry for more
2.2 over: WICKET! Nehra strikes, castles Mithum for 1. The left-hand pacer is looking dangerous here BAN 9/2
2 overs: Bumrah recovered well to keep it tight in the last few balls. BAN 9/0
1.1 overs: Four! Sarkar slaps one to the boundary. There was enough width outside off for him to make use off. Bumrah has not started well. BAN 7/0
Now Bumrah has the new ball in his hand
1 over: Three runs off Nehra's first over. Bumrah was slow to return the ball to the keeper from the fences. Both Dhoni and Nehra are not happy with the effort. BAN 3/0
0.5 overs: Ashish Nehra has been spot on in the first five balls. He is getting the ball to leave the left-hander. Impressive stuff! BAN 0/0
Bangladesh need 167 runs here. Their openers Soumya Sarkar and Mohammad Mithun are in the middle. Ashish Nehra has the new ball in his hand.

83 runs from 55 balls! Rohit Sharma inspires India to 166/6 INNINGS BREAK https://t.co/Ju4CN1CMI8 #BanvInd #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/97aFKwkL4Q

— ICC (@ICC) February 24, 2016
For the statistically inclined, India win 8 out of 10 matches after scoring over 160
We targeted 140 but happy to get 166, says Hardik Pandya after smashing 18-ball 31. He added that dew will be a big factor.
20 overs: SIX! Dhoni finishes off in typical fashion as India reach 166/3. This will be a big challenge for Bangladesh against a top-quality Indian bowling attack
19.5 overs: Dhoni hits that one away and run two. India 160/5
19.4 overs: WICKET! Pandya holds out to long-on as Al-Amin strikes again in the final over. India 158/6
19.3 overs: Dot-ball again. This is turning out to be a great last over from Al-Amin
19.2 overs: WICKET! Rohit is gone for 83, thanks to a sensational catch by Soumya Sarkar. Dhoni in the middle
19.1 overs: Al-Amin to bowl the last over. Pandya gives strike back to Rohit
18.2 overs: FOUR! Pandya slashes and the ball races away to the fence. Mustafizur under pressure
18.1 overs: Rohit takes a single as India reach 150/4
18 overs: India 149/4 with both Rohit and Pandya on fire
17.4 overs: FOUR! Pandya, you beauty! The Bangladesh attack is being taken to the sword
17.3 overs: FOUR! Whoa, that one was a wielding of the sword. Pandya is on fire as the Bangladesh fans are stunned into silence
17.1 overs: Al-Amin in the attack
17 overs: SIX! Pandya has blasted that into space. Twenty-one runs off that over and India reach 136/4
16.3 overs: SIX! Rohit smashes that one and despite a sensational effort from Shakib, the ball does not stay inside the ropes
16.2 overs: That's smart cricket by Pandya. He has just hit a boundary and then hands back strike to the settled batsman
16.1 overs: Mustafizur back in the attack Pandya finds the gap. FOUR! India 119/4
16 overs: FOUR! It's a Rohit Sharma special as India blaze away to 115/4.
15.5 overs: FOUR! Rohit is on a roll. These are important runs for India and surely 150 is now on the cards
15.3 overs: SIX! That one is OUT of here. Rohit muscles that Mortaza delivery over the ropes, India 107/4
15.2 overs: Rohit brings up the 100 for India
15.1 overs: Mortaza in the attack. Pandya showed he is a good, clean hitter in the last match vs Sri Lanka. Can he do it again here tonight?
15 overs: Hardik Pandya ahead of Mahendra Singh Dhoni. India 97/4
14.5 overs: WICKET! This is not what India wanted at this stage. Yuvraj Singh holds out in the deep off Shakib. India 97/4

.@YUVSTRONG12 now has 1,000 T20I runs! WATCH 36 of them in 6 balls here!! https://t.co/FZLsgu2RDN #AsiaCup #BanvInd pic.twitter.com/HfViOMt08C

— ICC (@ICC) February 24, 2016
14.1 overs: Rohit slams his 10th fifty off 41 balls as India reach 91/3
13.2 overs: Yuvraj drives one to the long-off boundary. Lucky for the left-hander there. Bangladesh fielding has been sub-standard today.
13 overs: End of Shakib's second over. Yuvraj and Rohit are trying to consolidate. IND 81/3
Yuvraj is playing the sidekick now. These two have stitched a 35-run partnership from 27 balls so far. Can India get to 150 here?
End of the 12th over. The last two overs have been productive for India thanks to Rohit. IND 76/3.
11.3 overs: Rohit hits one more boundary. He moves into the forties with that shot. IND 73/3.
11 overs: FOUR! Rohit takes 14 off the over as India race away to 66/3
10.5 overs: SIX! Rohit loves Bangladesh, doesn't he? He bailed the team out in the World Cup quarters and now he is a it again
10.4 overs: FOUR! Wow, cracking shot from Rohit. Dragged in short by Taskin and it races away to the fence
10.1 overs: Taskin back in the attack - he conceded only eight runs in his first two overs
10 overs: India reach 52/3. Rohit and Yuvraj have a certain score in mind for sure. They have put the big shots in the cupboard for now
9.4 overs: Rohit runs a single to bring up the 50 for India
9.1 overs: Mahumudullah to continue. Spin from both end now
9 overs: India 47/3; good over from Shakib, just four off it
8.1 overs: Shakib is in the attack. And the crowd breaks into another roar.

India on their toes! 22/2 as @BCBtigers' seamers enjoy conditions LIVE https://t.co/Ju4CN1CMI8 #BanvInd #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/6dEhXiHCO0

— ICC (@ICC) February 24, 2016
8 overs: This will be a massive challenge for Yuvraj Singh, the new man in. He has not batted much since his comeback and this is a tricky situation if there ever was one. India 43/3
7.5 overs: WICKET! Suresh Raina (13) falls to Mahumudullah as India skip to 42/3
7.1 overs: Spin! Mahmudullah in the attack now
7 overs: India 39/2. Have they thought of a good score on this surface yet? Very English conditions so far
6.5 overs: Raina hands strike back to Rohit for a single
6.4 overs: Raina is showing good intent here. He steps down the track to Mortaza and some good work near the ropes saved a couple of runs
6.1 overs: Mortaza to continue after removing Kohli
6 overs: Raina hits two boundaries in the over as India reach 31/2 at the end of the Powerplay
5.2 overs: FOUR! Take that, says Suresh Raina as he dismisses a poor delivery from Al-Amin from his presence. India 27/2
5.1 overs: Al-Amin replaces Mustafizur
5 overs: India 23/2 with Suresh Raina in the middle with Rohit Sharma.
4.3 overs: WICKET! Skipper Mashrafe Mortaza strikes in his first over as he removes the dangerous Virat Kohli for 8. India 22/2
4.1 overs: Rohit muscles that one but ooh he was lucky! The ball lands just short of Shakib in the deep. India 21/1
4 overs: India 19/1 after an excellent over from Mustafizur.

Thousands of adoring fans line-up to see #TeamIndia arrive at the stadium #IndvBan #AsiaCuphttps://t.co/Qt691381Po

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 24, 2016
3.4 overs: Kohli finally manages to put one in the gap for two. India 19/1
3.2 overs: Mustafizur has come back well since that wide. He has kept Kohli tied down
3.1 overs: Mustafizur Rahman in the attack and he starts off with a wide
3 overs: A fumble on the field from Bangladesh - rare one that - as India reach 16/1. Rohit and Kohli are the danger-men for the hosts right now
2.4 overs: Kohli nudges that one away on the on-side. India 14/1 as Rohit comes back on strike
2.3 overs: FOUR! Oh but that was off the inside edge. Relief for Kohli because that was too close to the stumps for comfort. India 13/1
2.1 overs: Taskin to continue.
2 overs: FOUR! Rohit Sharma hits the first boundary of the innings as India reach 9/1.
1.4 overs: Virat Kohli off the mark right away. India 5/1
1.3 overs: WICKET! That's the end of Shikhar Dhawan as that one went right through his defence. Hossain strikes early
2.1 overs: Al-Amin-Hossain in the attack and Dhawan runs two. He is a good runner between the wickets as is Rohit
1 over: India 2/0 after the first over from Taskin
India off the mark as Rohit pushes the second ball away on the off-side for a single
Movement for Taskin right away. Rohit was surprised by the extra pace off the pitch. Wow, this could be exciting
Taskin Ahmed has the new ball in hand. He is genuinely sharp and could trouble India's top-order on this green strip
Indian openers Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan are out in the middle
India have so far won five of their six T20s this year while Bangladesh have won two and lost two of the four T20s in 2016.
Less than 10 minutes to game-time and the Sher-e-Bangla stadium is packed to the rafters.
India win seven out of 10 matches when Virat Kohli scores more than 40 runs. How much will the No 2-ranked batsman score today?
Here's a look at the two teams

IND XI: RG Sharma, S Dhawan, V Kohli, S Raina, H Pandya, MS Dhoni, Y Singh, R Jadeja, R Ashwin, A Nehra, J Bumrah

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 24, 2016

BAN XI: I Kayes, Soumya Sarkar, S Rahman, Mahmudullah, S Al Hasan, M Rahim, M Mortaza, M Mithun, A Hossain, Mustafizur Rahman, T Ahmed

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 24, 2016
How many of these signature drives will Shikhar Dhawan play today?

Watch the @SDhawan25 signature drive in the nets #IndvBan #AsiaCuphttps://t.co/NxJSBMwiSi

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 23, 2016

Shikhar Dhawan: Feel am more positive and more confident now about my game. My role is to play my natural game and give strong starts to the side. The ODI series defeat is in the past. No point remembering the past
Bangladesh have won the toss and they will bowl first
MS Dhoni is fit to play! He has just walked out for the toss with Bangladesh skipper Mashrafe Mortaza
There's plenty of grass in the pitch and with overcast conditions, pacers will have a say in the early stages
Very interesting pitch here at Mirpur, says Harsha Bhogle

Here's how the pitch is looking for the #IndvBan match #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/ZBxkWLl6ZC

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 24, 2016
VVS Laxman wishes Team India ahead of the opening encounter

Good luck Team India for the Asia Cup?I am sure you will have a great tournament and get the desired result? #AsiaCup @BCCI

— VVS Laxman (@VVSLaxman281) February 24, 2016
There was some drizzle early in the morning but it looks alright now. But the Met department has predicted rain and thundershower this evening. Fingers crossed!
Mahendra Singh Dhoni is out inspecting the pitch as India gear up to take on Bangladesh in the opening match. Toss in less than 15 minutes

#TeamIndia Captain @msdhoni inspects the pitch ahead of the #IndvBan match #AsiaCup pic.twitter.com/Ccnbhf9gJy

— BCCI (@BCCI) February 24, 2016
We will be more interactive and present to you different perspectives from the match. Watch out for more videos, Tweets, pictures and more exciting features besides up-to-date coverage
India take on hosts Bangladesh in two hours in Dhaka. Welcome to our all-new cricket live blog!

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: India started off the Asia Cup campaign by beating Bangladesh by 45 runs.

highlights.highlight:
• This is the 13th edition of the Asia Cup but never before has the tournament been played in a T20 format
  • India and Sri Lanka have won the Asia Cup five times each while Pakistan have won twice
  • India and hosts Bangladesh will start off the first-ever Asia Cup T20 in Dhaka tonight
  • There is a threat of rain and thundershower later in the evening

metatags.pagetitle: Asia Cup T20: How Hardik Pandya's all-round show turned the tide in India's favour
metatags.metadescription: India started off the Asia Cup campaign by beating Bangladesh by 45 runs.
metatags.keywords: Bangladesh vs India,Asia Cup T20,MS Dhoni
